body:
Destroy job triggered for already deleted/not existing MS cluster is failing like this:
```
09:20:20 - MainThread - ocs_ci.utility.utils - WARNING  - Command stderr: Error: Can't retrieve cluster for key 'jm023mse2ep4-pr': There are no subscriptions or clusters with identifier or name 'jm023mse2ep4-pr'


tests/ecosystem/deployment/test_deployment.py::test_deployment ERROR

==================================== ERRORS ====================================
_____________________ ERROR at teardown of test_deployment _____________________
def cluster_teardown_finalizer():
        # If KMS is configured, clean up the backend resources

            try:

                log.error(f"Failed to cleanup KMS. Exception is: {ex}")
>       deployer.destroy_cluster(log_cli_level)

ocs_ci/utility/openshift_dedicated.py:70: in get_cluster_details

ocs_ci/utility/utils.py:477: in run_cmd
    completed_process = exec_cmd(
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 

cmd = ['ocm', 'describe', 'cluster', 'jm023mse2ep4-pr', '--json=true']
secrets = None, timeout = 600, ignore_error = False, threading_lock = None
silent = False, kwargs = {}
masked_cmd = 'ocm describe cluster jm023mse2ep4-pr --json=true'
completed_process = CompletedProcess(args=['ocm', 'describe', 'cluster', 'jm023mse2ep4-pr', '--json=true'], returncode=1, stdout=b'', stde...cluster for key 'jm023mse2ep4-pr': There are no subscriptions or clusters with identifier or name 'jm023mse2ep4-pr'\n")
masked_stdout = ''
masked_stderr = "Error: Can't retrieve cluster for key 'jm023mse2ep4-pr': There are no subscriptions or clusters with identifier or name 'jm023mse2ep4-pr'\n"

    def exec_cmd(
        cmd,
        secrets=None,
        timeout=600,
        ignore_error=False,
        threading_lock=None,
        silent=False,
        **kwargs,
    ):
        """
        Run an arbitrary command locally
    
        If the command is grep and matching pattern is not found, then this function
        returns "command terminated with exit code 1" in stderr.
    
        Args:
            cmd (str): command to run
            secrets (list): A list of secrets to be masked with asterisks
                This kwarg is popped in order to not interfere with
                subprocess.run(``**kwargs``)
            timeout (int): Timeout for the command, defaults to 600 seconds.
            ignore_error (bool): True if ignore non zero return code and do not
                raise the exception.
            threading_lock (threading.Lock): threading.Lock object that is used
                for handling concurrent oc commands
            silent (bool): If True will silent errors from the server, default false
    
        Raises:
            CommandFailed: In case the command execution fails
    
        Returns:
            (CompletedProcess) A CompletedProcess object of the command that was executed
            CompletedProcess attributes:
            args: The list or str args passed to run().
            returncode (str): The exit code of the process, negative for signals.
            stdout     (str): The standard output (None if not captured).
            stderr     (str): The standard error (None if not captured).
    
        """
        masked_cmd = mask_secrets(cmd, secrets)
        log.info(f"Executing command: {masked_cmd}")
        if isinstance(cmd, str):
            cmd = shlex.split(cmd)
        if threading_lock and cmd[0] == "oc":
            threading_lock.acquire()
        completed_process = subprocess.run(
            cmd,
            stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
            stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
            stdin=subprocess.PIPE,
            timeout=timeout,
            **kwargs,
        )
        if threading_lock and cmd[0] == "oc":
            threading_lock.release()
        masked_stdout = mask_secrets(completed_process.stdout.decode(), secrets)
        if len(completed_process.stdout) > 0:
            log.debug(f"Command stdout: {masked_stdout}")
        else:
            log.debug("Command stdout is empty")
    
        masked_stderr = mask_secrets(completed_process.stderr.decode(), secrets)
        if len(completed_process.stderr) > 0:
            if not silent:
                log.warning(f"Command stderr: {masked_stderr}")
        else:
            log.debug("Command stderr is empty")
        log.debug(f"Command return code: {completed_process.returncode}")
        if completed_process.returncode and not ignore_error:
            if (
                "grep" in masked_cmd
                and b"command terminated with exit code 1" in completed_process.stderr
            ):
                log.info(f"No results found for grep command: {masked_cmd}")
            else:
>               raise CommandFailed(
                    f"Error during execution of command: {masked_cmd}."
                    f"\nError is {masked_stderr}"
                )
E               ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.CommandFailed: Error during execution of command: ocm describe cluster jm023mse2ep4-pr --json=true.
E               Error is Error: Can't retrieve cluster for key 'jm023mse2ep4-pr': There are no subscriptions or clusters with identifier or name 'jm023mse2ep4-pr'

title: fix copy to pod, copy from pod functions
body:
tests/manage/z_cluster/test_ceph_pg_log_dups_trim.py::TestCephPgLogDupsTrimming::test_ceph_pg_log_dups_trim 
fails with out 

"""
Message: ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.CommandFailed: Error during execution of command: oc cp /tmp/textuppqn0gc.json /rook-ceph-osd-0-69574894fb-dgh9h:/tmp -n openshift-storage.
Error is Defaulted container "osd" out of: osd, log-collector, blkdevmapper (init), activate (init), expand-bluefs (init), chown-container-data-dir (init)
time="2023-01-10T22:49:38Z" level=error msg="exec failed: unable to start container process: exec: "tar": executable file not found in $PATH"
command terminated with exit code 255
"""

issue is consistent.

Chat thread was open - https://url.corp.redhat.com/2891ce2

Appears that 'tar' utility was dropped from ceph within implementation https://url.corp.redhat.com/7af7085 

Find and replace 'oc cp' in test framework with suggested `oc image extract` or find another way, preserving osd pods in initial state

title: Skip test_delete_rook_ceph_mon_pod for external mode
body:
**Deployment**:   OCS4-12-Downstream-OCP4-12-VSPHERE6-UPI-1AZ-RHCOS-EXTERNAL-3M-3W

**Test**: tests/manage/z_cluster/test_delete_rook_ceph_mon_pod.py::TestDeleteRookCephMonPod::test_delete_rook_ceph_mon_pod 

**Agenda**: we need to skip the test test_delete_rook_ceph_mon_pod for external deployment.
* In External mode there will be no any mon,osd,mds,mgr,rgw pods

**Requirement**: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1H_2D2f9LUWRqQTGbYcPVA3z3YIhEE-4hm3yUEb9WNC0/edit#slide=id.g900445dfe9_0_178

**Failure message**:
Message: AssertionError: All (20) attempts to delete rook-ceph-detect-version pod failed.
assert 0 > 0

where 0 = <tests.manage.z_cluster.test_delete_rook_ceph_mon_pod.TestDeleteRookCephMonPod object at 0x7f41865460a0>.num_of_deletions
Type: None

title: test_nodereplacement_proactive fail. terraform did not remove node

labels.name: platforms
labels.description: Related to support of deployment or test execution on particular platforms (baremetal, AWS, ...)

body:
[RP Stack trace](https://reportportal-ocs4.apps.ocp-c1.prod.psi.redhat.com/ui/#ocs/launches/all/6822/282252/282273/282274/log)

[Jenkins debug log](http://magna002.ceph.redhat.com/ocsci-jenkins/openshift-clusters/j-246vuf1cs36-t4a/j-246vuf1cs36-t4a_20221130T095104/logs/ocs-ci-logs-1669805220/by_outcome/failed/tests/manage/z_cluster/nodes/test_node_replacement_proactive.py/TestNodeReplacement/test_nodereplacement_proactive/logs)

Issue description:
**Node was not removed correctly with terraform state rm** 'module.compute_vm.vsphere_virtual_machine.vm["compute-5.j-246vuf1cs36-t4a.qe.rh-ocs.com"]' completely, so when we create again the node with terraform 
2022-11-30 11:37:57,419 - MainThread - INFO - ocs_ci.utility.utils.exec_cmd.601 - Executing command: /home/jenkins/bin/terraform apply -target=module.ipam_compute -refresh=false '-var-file=/home/jenkins/current-cluster-dir/openshift-cluster-dir/terraform_data/terraform.tfvars' -auto-approve  '/home/jenkins/workspace/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster-prod/ocs-ci/external/installer/upi/vsphere/' two nodes were created: new one 'compute-6' and one which was recently removed 'compute-5'. It was not expected due to a script, that two nodes will be created, hence the rule 
`node_util.create_and_attach_nodes_to_cluster(node_conf, node_type, num_nodes)
    for sample in TimeoutSampler(timeout=600, sleep=6, func=get_worker_nodes):
        if len(sample) == len(initial_nodes) + num_nodes:
            break` 
was never achieved, as number of len(initial_nodes) + num_nodes in this case is len(sample) + 1 and stay so with additional, unexpected compute-5 node

title: oc cluster user changes to system:anonymous which makes oc rsh operations to fail
body:
## Description of the problem

For some reason, it seems that user connected to a cluster changed to `system:anonymous` so that when a test case tried to use ceph tools pod:

```
oc -n openshift-storage rsh rook-ceph-tools-d4c8fb76b-zfvdf ceph osd ls --format json-pretty
```

It failed on access privileges:

```
Error from server (Forbidden): pods "rook-ceph-tools-d4c8fb76b-zfvdf" is forbidden: User "system:anonymous" cannot get resource "pods" in API group "" in the namespace "openshift-storage.
```

## Details

I fetched all logs of the run, and checked which `oc login` commands were used, but didn't find any test to relogin as `system:anonymous`, but as `system:admin`:

```
$ cd ~/tvorba/ci-runs/4.9.12-1/ocs-ci-logs-1666879952.tests
$ rg 'oc login'
tests/manage/rgw/test_object_bucket_size.py/test_object_bucket_size/logs
38547:              oc login -u system:admin
38705:              oc login -u system:admin
38865:              oc login -u system:admin
39023:              oc login -u system:admin
39181:              oc login -u system:admin
39339:              oc login -u system:admin

tests/manage/monitoring/prometheus/test_alerting_works.py/test_prometheus_rule_failures/logs
160:2022-10-27 17:32:51,835 - MainThread - INFO - ocs_ci.utility.utils.exec_cmd.601 - Executing command: oc login -u system:admin --kubeconfig /home/jenkins/current-cluster-dir/openshift-cluster-dir/auth/kubeconfig
```

Another interesting thing is that it's the only such failure in the whole test run:

```
$ rg 'Executing.*oc.*rook-ceph-tools' | wc -l
2134
$ rg 'ERROR.*oc.*rook-ceph-tools' | wc -l
1
```

Both before and after this failure, it's possible to run commands on a ceph toolbox pod without errors.

## References

I see this in one run of `test_monitoring_reporting_ok_when_idle` out of 5 for ODF 4.9.12-1.

title: Arbiter deployment is failing because net_split is already applied
body:
In the production job, since we split OCP and ODF deployment in two separate runs, the deployment is now failing:
https://url.corp.redhat.com/9378def

```
E               ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.CommandFailed: Error during execution of command: ['oc', '--kubeconfig', '/home/jenkins/current-cluster-dir/openshift-cluster-dir/auth/kubeconfig', 'create', '-f', '/tmp/ocs-ci-deployment-_af5uvn_/objectconfig.network-split.yaml', '-n', 'openshift-config', '-o', 'yaml'].
E               Error is Error from server (AlreadyExists): error when creating "/tmp/ocs-ci-deployment-_af5uvn_/objectconfig.network-split.yaml": machineconfigs.machineconfiguration.openshift.io "99-master-network-split" already exists
E               Error from server (AlreadyExists): error when creating "/tmp/ocs-ci-deployment-_af5uvn_/objectconfig.network-split.yaml": machineconfigs.machineconfiguration.openshift.io "99-worker-network-split" already exists

ocs_ci/utility/utils.py:636: CommandFailed
```

So we need to do setup netsplit right after OCP deployment and skip for ODF deployment.

As someone would like to do OCP deployment via OCS-CI , and then ODF manually, I think it's worth to apply net split in OCP deployment part.

title: Fix OCP().new_project()
body:
This condition https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/ocs/ocp.py#:~:text=if%20f%27Now%20using,)%3A would never be reached in scenarios such as below:

> Scenario:
> 
> - lets say the current project we're working on is "cosbench-project"
>   $ oc project
>   Using project "cosbench-project" on server "https:/".
> 
> - Now delete the `cosbench-project` project
>   $ oc delete project cosbench-project
>   project.project.openshift.io "cosbench-project" deleted
> 
> - Now again create the project `cosbench-project` using oc
>   $ oc new-project cosbench-project
>   Already on project "cosbench-project" on server "https:/".
>   
>   You can add applications to this project with the 'new-app' command. For example, try:
>   
>       oc new-app rails-postgresql-example
>   
>   to build a new example application in Ruby. Or use kubectl to deploy a simple Kubernetes application:
>   
>       kubectl create deployment hello-node --image=k8s.gcr.io/e2e-test-images/agnhost:2.33 -- /agnhost serve-hostname

In step 3, When you recreate the same project without before switching to some other project, command execution outputs says "Already on project" instead of "Now using project" and hence this piece of code https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/ocs/ocp.py#:~:text=if%20version.,%3Dlabel) would never be executed even on successful creation of new projects in scenarios like this.  and the code mentioned is a fix for https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/issues/6332

Test failures seen because of this:
https://url.corp.redhat.com/4e8b72b

Logs:
https://url.corp.redhat.com/cdcff5d

title: is_storage_reclaimed doesn't account for a large storage consumer starting to utilize storage while the teardown is running
body:
# Destription of the problem

When other workloads causes large uptick of utilized storage space while `ocs_ci.ocs.fiojob` workload fixture is waiting for storage to be reclaimed, it could fail on the fact that the space gets never reclaimed. Method `is_storage_reclaimed()` doesn't assume that there are *larger* consumers running during the teardown.

title: Use TimeoutIterator to fix too many failed Prometheus requests after upgrade

title: Handle endpoint unavailability after upgrade
body:
After upgrade there often happens that oc login creates invalid kubeconfig. The invalid kubeconfig contains all data but at the last line is dropped invalid string containing part of certificate used in the file. The kubeconfig is valid without this line. 

This is caused by cycle in a prometheus credentials refreshing loop. There is a fix for refreshing prometheus credentials when endpoint is unavailable. This usually fixes minor issues with endpoint availability but after upgrade after the endpoint is drained, the endpoint is unavailable for longer time and there is too many attempts to refresh the connection and during one of this attempts is corrupted kubeconfig (there is called oc login multiple times in a short time).

Code that refreshes connection after endpoint unavailability needs to be fixed: https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/6357c5040735aecd22e6a5513f261432accee051/ocs_ci/utility/prometheus.py#L423

title: Remove usage of check_clusters() function from pytest plugin code
body:
## Problem description

In https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/6038/files PR, function `check_clusters()` was introduced into [ocscilib.py](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/6038/files#diff-81dd75ca7912048f20e991916771e11b16203494498849a39b6189401b3ac974) module.

This is not a good idea, because the plugin code is executed during all use cases of pytest run, from running `run-ci --help`, to running unit tests, where we don't expect cluster to exist.

This already breaks other PRs, eg. unit tests of these are failing because of that:

- https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/6051 (removing check_clusters import from the ocscilib.py file fixes the problem with circular dependency there)

It also causes confusing errors, eg.:

- when toolbox pod is not properly initialized on a bare metal cluster, pytest or run-ci fails during internal initialization, with `Error is error: the server doesn't have a resource type "lvmcluster"` which is confusing

## Possible solutions

- The import and usage of this function needs to be removed, and the functionality placed somewhere else.
- The function would need to be moved into a dedicated module, and updated so that it properly handles errors.

title: workaround: Open BZ-SDA-6346 causes the #6066 in ci Pipeline, OCP test deployment failure
body:
ROSA cluster status turns to ready even without creating all the nodes (3master 3 workers and 3 infra) 
The issue is open with service development A board https://issues.redhat.com/browse/SDA-6346
More details of ocs-ci are reported in the issue https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/issues/6066 
Summary  - OCP test deployment check for node count and in managed service expected nodes count is 9 and a node does not get created within time i.e before rosa cluster ready status. Hence the test gets failed and breaks the pipeline. Hence even the deployment job does not install (OCS) addon. So applying a workaround for now to ignore this test. https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/6095 
This workaround needs to revert to test as soon as  https://issues.redhat.com/browse/SDA-6346 get resolved.

title: get_resource can not choose from last column
body:
When using the get_resource function the selected column can not be the las one since the regex does not split the lines.

for example:
the output of the command `oc -n openshift-storage get CephFilesystem ocs-storagecluster-cephfilesystem -n openshift-storage` is :
```
NAME                                ACTIVEMDS   AGE     PHASE
ocs-storagecluster-cephfilesystem   1           3m23s   Ready

```
and the list of columns in the function is : 

['NAME', 'ACTIVEMDS', 'AGE', 'PHASE ocs-storagecluster-cephfilesystem', '1', '29s', 'Ready']

title: `test_multiregion_mirror` is too fragile and needs more retry mechanisms

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
At the moment, the test is testing IO in a disruptive case. The scenario oftentimes causes race conditions that do not necessarily reflect real-life usage.
Thus, functions such as `sync_object_directory` need to be wrapped with a `retry()` to make sure that the test doesn't fail due to such race conditions

title: CLI PVPool tests fail due to incorrect CLI usage

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
At the moment, OCS-CI uses the upstream MCG CLI by pulling the binary from the operator pod.
However, this presents a bug where OCS-CI is prompted to pick whether to use an existing secret - 
```
INFO[0002] ✅ Exists: Secret "rook-ceph-object-user-ocs-storagecluster-cephobjectstore-noobaa-ceph-objectstore-user"
INFO[0002] Found a Secret in the system with the same credentials (rook-ceph-object-user-ocs-storagecluster-cephobjectstore-noobaa-ceph-objectstore-user)
INFO[0002] Note that using more then one secret with the same credentials is not supported
INFO[0002] do you want to use it for this Backingstore? y/n
```

When answering with `y`, the creation continues, but then the backingstore hangs in a `Creating` state, with the following status:
```
Phase is "Creating": TemporaryError BackingStore Still didn't connect all requested pods. 1 from 1 are pending
```
This continues well after the pod is `Running`.
This does not occur when using the proper downstream CLI - the "existing secret" dialog is never presented.
I do not know of a workaround at the moment.

title: Function wait_for_resource didn't properly handle resource_count=0
body:
Managed Service Consumer cluster deployment is failing on `mon_health_check`, because there is no _mon_ pods and function `wait_for_resource` didn't properly handle waiting for _no pod_ (`resource_count = 0`).

The job is failing on `MonCountException: Failed to achieve desired Mon count 0` - but there **is zero** _mon_ pods.

title: Cleanup leftovers after destroying ROSA cluster
body:
When ROSA cluster destroy process is triggered, the job finish before the cluster is fully destroyed and also there seems to be some leftovers (e.g. OpenIDConnectProvider).

The destroy process should wait till the cluster is fully destroyed and it should cleanup any remaining leftover resources.

title: get_ocs_csv loops for 7 hours waiting for nonexistent OCS version
body:
I have encountered this issue while testing ACM Hub Downstream deployments where there is no OCS being deployed. We have a check on some of our tests to determine whether they will be skipped or not, one of which is [skipif_upgraded_from](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/utility/utils.py#L3396-L3423). This check is calling `get_ocs_csv` which is failing due to the fact that OCS is not installed on this cluster, which then proceeds to loop for seven hours before the execution finally fails.

Not only should this check be taking into consideration the possibility that OCS doesn't exist in the test environment, but we should be moving on much sooner. In addition, these checks shouldn't even be performed unless they are on tests that are being specified to actually run. For this example I'm trying to run a `deployment` test, yet we have dozens of checks being performed to determine whether or not some tests can be skipped, even though they won't be executed anyways. This is a big area where we can make performance improvements as these checks take a non-trivial amount of time to execute. I have opened an [issue](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/issues/5788) to track this as well.

You can see this behavior present in this execution: https://ocs4-jenkins-csb-odf-qe.apps.ocp-c1.prod.psi.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/12044/consoleFull

title: Test skipif checks being performed on tests that aren't specified to run
body:
I noticed that we have `skipif_some_condition` checks being performed on dozens of tests at the start of any execution, regardless of the fact that they aren't even marked with the test marker specified when executing `run-ci`. This is wasting a lot of time at the beginning of executions, especially when bugs appear in these checks. 

We should only be performing these checks on tests that have been officially gathered by pytest for the current execution, not prior to that.

You can see what I'm talking about in this execution where only `deployment` tests should be executed: https://ocs4-jenkins-csb-odf-qe.apps.ocp-c1.prod.psi.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/12044/consoleFull

title: Markers skipif_ms_provider and skipif_ms_consumer are not working correctly
body:
The markers `skipif_ms_provider` and `skipif_ms_consumer` are not working correctly. For example in [this run](https://ocs4-jenkins-csb-odf-qe.apps.ocp-c1.prod.psi.redhat.com/job/qe-odf-multicluster/86/consoleFull) first (default) cluster is consumer and second cluster is provider but all the tests were skipped even though the tests have `@skipif_ms_provider` mark.

Initially I was thinking, that the problem is in `gather_version_info_for_report(...)` function called in `ocs_ci/framework/pytest_customization/ocscilib.py:pytest_configure` - there is raised exception, but it is properly handled.

The main problem here probably is, that the `@skipif*` marks are processed during collecting the tests, before the default context is fully set (not sure about the exact order). So now, it seems, that it depend on the last specified cluster, no matter which cluster is specified as _default_ (the first one or specified via `--default-cluster-context-index`)

title: Adapt `test_log_reader_writer_parallel` for disconnected environment
body:
When `test_log_reader_writer_parallel` is executed in disconnected cluster, the workload won't start:

```
ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.UnexpectedBehaviour: unexpected problem with start of the workload, cluster is either misconfigured or broken
```

Since quay.io is obviously not reachable when access to external internet is not available.

```
  Warning  Failed                  3m47s (x6 over 5m6s)  kubelet                  Error: ImagePullBackOff
  Normal   Pulling                 3m34s (x4 over 5m7s)  kubelet                  Pulling image "quay.io/mbukatov/logwriter:ocs-ci"
  Warning  Failed                  3m34s (x4 over 5m7s)  kubelet                  Failed to pull image "quay.io/mbukatov/logwriter:ocs-ci": rpc error: code = Unknown desc = pinging container registry quay.io: Get "https://quay.io/v2/": Forbidden
  Warning  Failed                  3m34s (x4 over 5m7s)  kubelet                  Error: ErrImagePull
  Normal   BackOff                 3m20s (x7 over 5m6s)  kubelet                  Back-off pulling image "quay.io/mbukatov/logwriter:ocs-ci"
```

The test case needs to be adapted for this environment:

```
 if config.DEPLOYMENT.get("disconnected"):
     image_mirror = mirror_image(image)
```

title: Update `test_log_reader_writer_parallel` to handle restart of a container during rsync fetching phase
body:
During rsync data fetching phase of `test_log_reader_writer_parallel`, it sometimes happen (in about 10% of cases in production runs)  that container of the workload pod is restarted (likely because of cpu utilization?), and so it's not available for brief period of time.

For this reason, rsync should be able to handle such error, and retry after a short waiting period.

## Example

```
$ oc get pods
NAME                                READY   STATUS    RESTARTS      AGE

title: run-ci immediately fails on a runtime error (import file mismatch)
body:
Pytest immediately fails on a runtime error, when I try to deploy a cluster with run-ci.

It looks like pytest discovery is reaching out to `external` directory, which is not expected.

I have tried to remove all `*.pyc` files in my ocs-ci repository, and reinstall virtual env, without any effect.

## Steps to reproduce

Use ocs-ci to deploy a cluster:

```
$ run-ci --deploy -m deployment --cluster-name mbukatov-0223b --cluster-path /home/ocsqe/data/mbukatov-0223b-local --ocp-version 4.10 --ocs-version 4.10 --upgrade-ocs-version 4.10 --ocsci-conf=conf/deployment/vsphere/upi_1az_rhcos_vsan_lso_vmdk_3m_3w.yaml --ocsci-conf=/home/ocsqe/projects/ocs-ci-data/vSphere7-DC-CP_VC1.yaml --ocsci-conf=/home/ocsqe/data/mbukatov-0223b-local.conf.yaml --ocsci-conf=conf/examples/without_presistent_monitoring.yaml

title: [IBM Z] Fix test case for external mode
body:
While testing odf in external mode, Noticed with test `tests/e2e/workloads/test_data_consistency.py::test_log_reader_writer_parallel`  is not using external storage class even though external mode parameters are passed in the ocs-ci config.

```
    @tier1
    @marks.bugzilla("1989301")
    @pytest.mark.polarion_id("OCS-2735")
    def test_log_reader_writer_parallel(project, tmp_path):
        """
        Write and read logfile stored on cephfs volume, from all worker nodes of a
        cluster via k8s Deployment, while fetching content of the stored data via
        oc rsync to check the data locally.

        Reproduces BZ 1989301. Test failure means new blocker high priority bug.
        """
        pvc_dict = get_pvc_dict()
        # we need to mount the volume on every worker node, so RWX/cephfs
        pvc_dict["metadata"]["name"] = "logwriter-cephfs-many"
        pvc_dict["spec"]["accessModes"] = [constants.ACCESS_MODE_RWX]
        pvc_dict["spec"]["storageClassName"] = constants.CEPHFILESYSTEM_SC
        # there is no need for lot of storage capacity for this test
        pvc_dict["spec"]["resources"]["requests"]["storage"] = "1Gi"
```

Storagclassname is referring to a constant which is static. https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/ocs/constants.py#L113

Logs: https://drive.google.com/file/d/15_aEMKshw6dEugjLMgIIe4emHahh2Seg/view?usp=sharing

E           ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.CommandFailed: Error during execution of command: ['oc', 'login', '-u', 'apikey', '-p', '*****'].

title: Sf parameters
body: updating the benchmark parameters names to align with the upstream benchmark names, so we can collect test results.

title: `skip_ocs_deployment` causes OCS-CI to ignore various test markers
body:
Due to the flow here - 
https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/a8c4a806c295677be565cba42e33a747b5908bca/tests/conftest.py#L171

Several `skipif` markers are not being respected.
However, it makes sense to set `skip_ocs_deployment` to `True` in cases where the cluster already has OCS installed, and users just want to run the OCS-CI test suite.

One problematic scenario that this led to, has been a user which set the variable to true, since he deployed ODF separately, and then ran the test suite. Tests that should've been skipped, weren't skipped.

The relevant changed was introduced in #4051 in order to handle cases of OCP-only deployments, but the flag might also be set to true in cases where OCS was already deployed beforehand.

title: Wrong usage of [rl]strip(...) methods
body:
Today, when working on PR https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/5008, I spotted [incorrect usage](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/5008#issuecomment-956155868) of `lstrip(...)` method. Method [`lstrip([chars])`](https://docs.python.org/3.9/library/stdtypes.html#bytes.lstrip) (and similarly `rstrip()` is removing subset of individual characters, not whole string prefix, which might cause various issues and unexpected behavior.
 
There are more issues like the above in the _ocs-ci_ code:
* [ocs_ci/deployment/helpers/vsphere_helpers.py#L216](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/deployment/helpers/vsphere_helpers.py#L216)
* [ocs_ci/utility/utils.py#L581](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/utility/utils.py#L581)
* [ocs_ci/utility/utils.py#L2501](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/utility/utils.py#L2501)
* [ocs_ci/ocs/fio_artefacts.py#L46](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/ocs/fio_artefacts.py#L46)
* [ocs_ci/ocs/ocp.py#L1183](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/ocs/ocp.py#L1183)
* [ocs_ci/ocs/ocp.py#L1303](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/ocs/ocp.py#L1303)

title: MCG DB SCC has changed in ODF 4.9

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
As part of ODF 4.9, the `openshift.io/scc: noobaa` annotation of the `noobaa-db-pg-0` pod was changed to `openshift.io/scc: noobaa-endpoint`.
In addition, this is future to change further in https://github.com/noobaa/noobaa-operator/pull/743.
Once all SCC changes are finalized for 4.9, we should fix `test_db_scc` to support them. Until then, it's expected to fail on OCS 4.9.

title: Running tests over MCG-only clusters is not supported in OCS-CI
body: At the moment, when OCS-CI is run on a cluster installed in an "MCG-Only" configuration, it fails in several parts, namely - the installation of the Ceph toolbox and the RGW pod check under `mcg.py`.

title: storagesystem name on UI reflects a different name when an ODF 4.9 cluster is deployed via ocs-ci (Jenkins)
body:
If the installation is done via UI, the storagesystem name is shown as 'ocs-storagecluster-storagesystem' whereas, if we deploy the cluster via Jenkins, the name is displayed as 'storagesystem-odf'. We need to keep it consistent as it may be the cause of many UI automation test failures due to name mismatch.

@vavuthu @jilju @OdedViner @ebenahar

title: Console plugin should be by-default 'Enabled' when we deploy an ODF 4.9 cluster via ocs-ci (Jenkins)
body: Currently, the value is set to 'Disabled' and thus, user can not see ODF tab under Storage until this option is explicitly enabled from UI.

title: Missing storage_type parameter for block volume mode in tests
body:
Tests
1. test_resource_deletion_during_pod_pvc_deletion.py
2. test_ceph_daemon_kill_during_resource_deletion.py

The value of ```storage_type``` is passed as ```fs``` for all volume modes. ```storage_type``` should be passed as ```block``` if volume mode of the PVC  is Block.
```
pod_obj.run_io(
                storage_type="fs", size=f"{io_size}G", fio_filename=f"{pod_obj.name}_io"
            )
```

            stdout     (str): The standard output (None if not captured).
            stderr     (str): The standard error (None if not captured).
    
        """
        masked_cmd = mask_secrets(cmd, secrets)
        log.info(f"Executing command: {masked_cmd}")
        if isinstance(cmd, str):
            cmd = shlex.split(cmd)
        completed_process = subprocess.run(
            cmd,
            stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
            stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
            stdin=subprocess.PIPE,
            timeout=timeout,
            **kwargs,
        )
        masked_stdout = mask_secrets(completed_process.stdout.decode(), secrets)
        if len(completed_process.stdout) > 0:
            log.debug(f"Command stdout: {masked_stdout}")
        else:
            log.debug("Command stdout is empty")
    
        masked_stderr = mask_secrets(completed_process.stderr.decode(), secrets)
        if len(completed_process.stderr) > 0:
            log.warning(f"Command stderr: {masked_stderr}")
        else:
            log.debug("Command stderr is empty")
        log.debug(f"Command return code: {completed_process.returncode}")
        if completed_process.returncode and not ignore_error:
>           raise CommandFailed(
                f"Error during execution of command: {masked_cmd}."
                f"\nError is {masked_stderr}"
            )

title: SameNamePrefixClusterAlreadyExistsException when using j- prefix locally for AWS UPI deployment
body:
```
self = <ocs_ci.deployment.aws.AWSUPI object at 0x7fcc98269ef0>, log_cli_level = 'INFO'

    def deploy_ocp(self, log_cli_level="DEBUG"):
        """
        Deployment specific to OCP cluster on a cloud platform.

        Args:
            log_cli_level (str): openshift installer's log level
                (default: "DEBUG")

        """
        if not config.DEPLOYMENT.get("force_deploy_multiple_clusters"):
            cluster_name_parts = self.cluster_name.split("-")
            prefix = cluster_name_parts[0]
            import pdb
            pdb.set_trace()
>           if prefix.lower() in self.cluster_prefixes_special_rules:
E           ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.SameNamePrefixClusterAlreadyExistsException: Cluster with name prefix j already exists. Please destroy the existing cluster for a new cluster deployment

ocs_ci/deployment/cloud.py:66: SameNamePrefixClusterAlreadyExistsException
```

When trying to deploy a cluster locally using the cluster name `j-999au3r33-t4an` I am seeing the above error. This is due to two things:

1. The way we are parsing out the "prefix" that is in use (not to be confused with the CLUSTER_PREFIX from jenkins, but essentially the provided cluster name without the test tier addition at the end). We are splitting the string on hyphens and grabbing chunks. This is unreliable as we have prefixes with hyphens in them as well as the fact we can't know if the cluster name has hyphens in it either. It is also why the above error considers `j` to be the prefix while we really want to check for `j-\\d\\d\\d`. We should instead be checking if the provided cluster name starts with one of our exception stings/patterns.
2. The [dictionary](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/deployment/cloud.py#L39) we are checking to see if a cluster "prefix" is one of our defined cluster prefixes in order to dismiss it is instantiated as an empty dict. We are [updating](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/deployment/aws.py#L176) this value in the `AWSIPI` class, but not the `AWSUPI` class. We should probably move this to `AWSBase` or instantiate it in `CloudDeploymentBase` this way if we want the same rules to apply to all cloud providers.

title: AWS UPI deployment fails with cluster prefix
body:
Ex1: https://ocs4-jenkins-csb-ocsqe.apps.ocp4.prod.psi.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster-prod/1655/console
Ex2: https://ocs4-jenkins-csb-ocsqe.apps.ocp4.prod.psi.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster-prod/1659/console

The cluster prefix in these deployments is being passed to ocs-ci correctly but being altered by something in the UPI script process. The UPI script tries to create a VPC with a hyphen at the start (missing the prefix) and fails. We need to debug the UPI process and determine what is changing the cluster name string and removing the prefix.

You get this error in all AWS regions except US East (N. Virginia) region, us-east-1. In us-east-1 region, you will get 200 OK, but it is no-op (if bucket exists it Amazon S3 will not do anything).

title: Snapshots created using snapshot_factory are not deleted in teardown session
body: Snapshots created using ```snapshot_factory``` are not deleted in teardown session. The snapshots created are not added to the list ```instances``` which will be used to identify the snapshots to be deleted by the finalizer.

title: Incorrect test structure in report portal in some cases
body:
I recently noticed that in some cases, structure of test run reports as provided in report portal is wrong, which hinders orientation in test run results, and could make people miss test case failures.

In the following example `tests/manage/monitoring/prometheusmetrics/test_monitoring_defaults.py` test module contains totally unrelated `tests/manage/z_cluster/test_ceph_default_values_check.py` module:

![reportportalissue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4759819/126686290-0f063514-6701-4005-8526-d4a682b1c24f.png)

It could be caused by report portal integration code in ocs-ci, which pushes test results there, or by something else.

Discussed with @clacroix12 and @vasukulkarni during today's OCS Automation meeting.

title: Fix `get_ocs_version()`
body:
By default, `get_ocs_version` checks for the version of the first CSV it can find.
However, the first CSV is now the ElasticSearch operator, which means the function returns its version, instead of the OCS one.

title: Test case test_verify_rwo_using_replicated_pod failed
body:
Test case
```tests.manage.pv_services.test_verify_rwo_using_dc_pod.TestVerifyRwoUsingReplicatedPod.test_verify_rwo_using_replicated_pod[CephBlockPool]```
failed due to the error given below.

```
>               raise self.timeout_exc_cls(*self.timeout_exc_args)
E               ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.TimeoutExpiredError: Timed out after 360s running get("pod-test-rbd-75591c00bd8e480ebcc91d33c9a-1-deploy", True, None)

ocs_ci/utility/utils.py:1002: TimeoutExpiredError
```
The test case creates DC with replica value 5 and expects at least one replica pod to be Pending and deploy pod be in Running state. This expectation is set because an RWO PVC is used. So among the 5 replica pods, only the pods which are residing on the same node will reach the Running state. So the deploy pod should remain in Running state. 

But in this case, all the 5 replicas were scheduled on the same node and the deploy pod reached the Completed state.
```
12:40:01 - MainThread - ocs_ci.ocs.ocp - INFO - status of pod-test-rbd-75591c00bd8e480ebcc91d33c9a-1-deploy at column STATUS was Completed, but we were waiting for Running
```
This situation is not handled in the test case.

Failed in RUN ID: 1622715438

The file test.yaml will be created only if the test case is executed.

title: ClusterLoad: timeout is not enforced while determining the cluster IOPS limit
body:
Cluster load (https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/ocs/cluster_load.py) should run in separate thread. Now it can delay some tests for hours. E.g. `test_load_crush_map` test was delayed by 6 hours in https://ocs4-jenkins-csb-ocsqe.apps.ocp4.prod.psi.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster-prod/1003/consoleFull. In the run the `test_load_crush_map` test failed due to ceph health error that was caused by utilizing all osds by background io.
```
ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.CephHealthException: Ceph cluster health is not OK. Health: HEALTH_ERR 3 full osd(s); 3 pool(s) full
```

title: ocs_ci.helpers.helpers.fetch_used_size is skipping verification
body:
In ocs_ci.helpers.helpers the function ```fetch_used_size``` is comparing float to bool for verifying the actual used size. As the conditional statement always return False, the verification will be skipped.
https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/314f47508c862f7aa8870736246b6927a012aba9/ocs_ci/helpers/helpers.py#L2936

labels.name: RGW

Currently, the test begins by looking for RGW deployments on the cluster - 
```
rgw_deployment = pod.get_deployments_having_label(
            constants.RGW_APP_LABEL, defaults.ROOK_CLUSTER_NAMESPACE

However, modes running in external mode do not have the deployment, leading the test to fail with an IndexError (because of the `[0]`).

I believe the tests should be skipped in external mode - @ebenahar?

title: Explicitelly handle empty content["data"]["result"] in PrometheusAPI.query_range()
body:
Method `PrometheusAPI.query_range()` should handle empty `content["data"]["result"]` so that:
- clear warning about empty response is logged
- exception is not raised

Evaluation whether an empty response is ok or not is done by the test.

We need to fix this for IBM Cloud scenario.

title: Teardown can fail on problem with openshift-release API
body:
I started a teardown and it failed on a problem related to communication with openshift release API:

```
E           requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='openshift-release.apps.ci.l2s4.p1.openshiftapps.com', port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /api/v1/releasestream/4.7.0-0.nightly/latest (Caused by NewConnectionError('<urllib3.connection.HTTPSConnection object at 0x7fbbb415ffd0>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 110] Connection timed out'))
```

This kind of issue should not happen during teardown. Why is ocs-ci try to communicate with  `openshift-release.apps.ci.l2s4.p1.openshiftapps.com` during teardown? I don't believe there is a valid reason for this to be happening during teardown. Moreover it makes teardown more prone to failure, which is not a good thing considering a cleanup issues it can cause.

title: Unavailable OCP version URL results in cluster fixture failures for all tests
body:
[expose_ocp_version](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/utility/utils.py#L553) causes the [cluster](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/tests/conftest.py#L1109) session scope fixture to fail for every test in the suite if the URL where we retrieve the version information from is unavailable. You can see this in the following jenkins execution:

Jenkins: https://ocs4-jenkins-csb-ocsqe.apps.ocp4.prod.psi.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster-prod/541/
Logs: http://magna002.ceph.redhat.com/ocsci-jenkins/openshift-clusters/j018ai3c33-p/j018ai3c33-p_20210423T170302/logs/

This is happening because we are now using `expose_ocp_version` within [get_openshift_client](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/utility/utils.py#L681) to convert the configured version to a full legitimate version string. We can make get_openshift_client more robust by excepting the `AssertionError` raised by `expose_ocp_version` and skip over the version comparison.

title: TimeoutExpiredError is called without positional parameter value
body:
Implementation of TimeoutExpiredError requires to add positional parameter `value` when called:
https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/ocs/exceptions.py#L32

This is not done on some places and should be fixed:
https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/search?q=%22raise+TimeoutExpiredError%22

title: [vSphere] test_nodereplacement_proactive needs to be skipped due to BZ 1953360
body:
The nodes did not come up in the allowed timeout, which seems to be 5 minutes.

The VMs were powered off here:
2021-04-24 14:18:21,892 - MainThread - INFO - ocs_ci.utility.vsphere.stop_vms.458 - Powering off VMs: ['compute-1', 'compute-2', 'compute-3', 'compute-4', 'compute-5', 'compute-6', 'control-plane-0', 'control-plane-1', 'control-plane-2']

And failed to come up:
2021-04-24 14:23:27,472 - MainThread - INFO - ocs_ci.utility.vsphere.start_vms.496 - Waiting for VMs ['compute-1', 'compute-2', 'compute-3', 'compute-4', 'compute-5', 'compute-6', 'control-plane-0', 'control-plane-1', 'control-plane-2'] to power on based on network connectivity. Current VMs IPs: ['10.1.160.55', '10.1.160.56', None, '10.1.160.36', '10.1.160.73', '10.1.160.39', '10.1.160.44', '10.1.160.76', '10.1.160.63']

Must gather seems to be collected successfully, so I assume that by the time it was collected, the nodes came up and the cluster was reachable.

We can consider increasing the time we wait for nodes to come back from stop and start.

title: Call get_openshift_client before we try to use oc
body:
Currently we are trying to use `oc` to check cluster-info and other things after setting the `kubeconfig` path. This process happens before the call to download the openshift client. This only happens if the kubeconfig exists so for fresh deployments we are not seeing any issues, however if you are trying to run tests or a teardown while missing `oc` from the bin_path, you will hit the following error:

```
INTERNALERROR> Traceback (most recent call last):
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/main.py", line 193, in wrap_session
INTERNALERROR>     config._do_configure()
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/config/__init__.py", line 778, in _do_configure
INTERNALERROR>     self.hook.pytest_configure.call_historic(kwargs=dict(config=self))
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/hooks.py", line 308, in call_historic
INTERNALERROR>     res = self._hookexec(self, self.get_hookimpls(), kwargs)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/manager.py", line 93, in _hookexec
INTERNALERROR>     return self._inner_hookexec(hook, methods, kwargs)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/manager.py", line 87, in <lambda>
INTERNALERROR>     firstresult=hook.spec.opts.get("firstresult") if hook.spec else False,
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/callers.py", line 208, in _multicall
INTERNALERROR>     return outcome.get_result()
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/callers.py", line 80, in get_result
INTERNALERROR>     raise ex[1].with_traceback(ex[2])
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pluggy/callers.py", line 187, in _multicall
INTERNALERROR>     res = hook_impl.function(*args)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/ocs_ci/framework/pytest_customization/ocscilib.py", line 269, in pytest_configure
INTERNALERROR>     process_cluster_cli_params(config)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/ocs_ci/framework/pytest_customization/ocscilib.py", line 417, in process_cluster_cli_params
INTERNALERROR>     os.path.join(cluster_path, ocsci_config.RUN["kubeconfig_location"])
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/ocs_ci/ocs/openshift_ops.py", line 147, in set_kubeconfig
INTERNALERROR>     run_cmd("oc cluster-info")
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/ocs_ci/utility/utils.py", line 455, in run_cmd
INTERNALERROR>     completed_process = exec_cmd(cmd, secrets, timeout, ignore_error, **kwargs)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Users/clacroix/workspace/ocs-ci/ocs_ci/utility/utils.py", line 494, in exec_cmd
INTERNALERROR>     **kwargs,
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 472, in run
INTERNALERROR>     with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as process:
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 775, in __init__
INTERNALERROR>     restore_signals, start_new_session)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 1522, in _execute_child
INTERNALERROR>     raise child_exception_type(errno_num, err_msg, err_filename)
INTERNALERROR> FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'oc': 'oc'
```

We should either move the call to download the openshift_client to before this code (in `pytest_configure`), or add a check here that ensures `oc` exists in the `bin_dir` and performs a call to download it if it does not.

title: `test_read_non_cached_object[AWS-OC-Cache]` fails most of the time

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
The test seems to fail because the object that's read via the NS bucket isn't cached by the time we check whether it is.
I believe it's necessary to wait a few seconds in order to let MCG cache the object before we check it (right now the check is performed right after reading the object)

title: Namespace CRD tests and Bucketclass code can be improved

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
As part of #3921 , we inserted a large amount of changes to our codebase. However, some can be improved or fixed, and need to be verified.

already known issues are: 

* Under [test_namespace_bucket_creation_with_many_resources_crd](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/256ff0f5ee22eaa1dc2000385403d4ae34f671c4/tests/manage/mcg/test_namespace_crd.py#L522) there is a typo (Mul*s*ti instead of Multi)

* Code duplication in the [bucketclass resource](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/256ff0f5ee22eaa1dc2000385403d4ae34f671c4/ocs_ci/ocs/resources/bucketclass.py#L119) the if should only include which namespaces to use (create new or use existing)

* Bucket instantiation can be shortened like the code above the line [here](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/256ff0f5ee22eaa1dc2000385403d4ae34f671c4/tests/manage/mcg/test_namespace_crd.py#L464)  or [here](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/256ff0f5ee22eaa1dc2000385403d4ae34f671c4/tests/manage/mcg/test_namespace_crd.py#L527) by using just the bucket_factory and only extracting the necessary resources's names within the test logic.

* Several functions are duplicated in both the [CRD](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/256ff0f5ee22eaa1dc2000385403d4ae34f671c4/tests/manage/mcg/test_namespace_crd.py#L608) and [RPC](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/256ff0f5ee22eaa1dc2000385403d4ae34f671c4/tests/manage/mcg/test_namespace_rpc.py#L573) files and can be either moved to a single, third source, or replaced entirely by existing functions which fill  the same purpose such as: [compare_directory](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/256ff0f5ee22eaa1dc2000385403d4ae34f671c4/ocs_ci/ocs/bucket_utils.py#L1042) and [sync_object_directory](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/256ff0f5ee22eaa1dc2000385403d4ae34f671c4/ocs_ci/ocs/bucket_utils.py#L140)

labels.name: platforms
labels.description: Related to support of deployment or test execution on particular platforms (baremetal, AWS, ...)

body:
This test always fails on non-amd64 platforms because `quay.io/ocsci/git-alpine-image` isn't multi-arch. We should either:

* Use a different image
* Build the image on all arches
* Exclude the test from platforms it won't run on
* Remove the acceptance marker from the test

title: Fix validate_ocs_pods_on_pvc for UI deployment

labels.name: Verified
labels.description: Mark when PR was verified and log provided

body:
Fixes: #4022

Signed-off-by: Petr Balogh <pbalogh@redhat.com>

title: DeviceSet for LSO UI deployment is named: ocs-deviceset-localblock
body:
In UI deployment we found out that we do not change name for deviceset for LSO deployment in CLI deployment.

UI deployed cluster deviceset name:  `ocs-deviceset-localblock`

CLI OCS-CI deployed cluster deviceset name:  `ocs-deviceset`

Hence our verification function for OSD on PVC is failing as you can see we don't have the same name of PVC in OSD pod:
```
Pods:
'rook-ceph-osd-prepare-ocs-deviceset-localblock-0-data-07vmn8nbg', 
'rook-ceph-osd-prepare-ocs-deviceset-localblock-0-data-1dbc6ztcx', 
'rook-ceph-osd-prepare-ocs-deviceset-localblock-0-data-2cxzwh4qz',

PVC:
'ocs-deviceset-localblock-0-data-07vmfr' 
'ocs-deviceset-localblock-0-data-1dbcfm'
'ocs-deviceset-localblock-0-data-2cxz4d'
```


The other issue for LSO deployment is that get_osd_size trying to get size from storageCluster CR but when we deploy via UI the size is set to 1.  To solve this we can take the size from PVC.

title: Resolve DeprecationWarnings Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated since Python 3.3
body:
There are few instances of `DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated since Python 3.3, and in 3.10 it will stop working`:

```
ocs_ci/framework/__init__.py:107
  /home/ocsqe/projects/ocs-ci-unittest/ocs_ci/framework/__init__.py:107: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated since Python 3.3, and in 3.10 it will stop working

title: Workaround: tests who use `rgw_deployments` for skipping force-skip on IBM Cloud

labels.name: MCG-4.11
labels.description: Issues that should be fixed as part of the MCG 4.11 coverage efforts

body:
Because of [this bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926831), RGW deployments can always be found in IBM Cloud clusters.
However, the deployments should only exist in case COS is not available.
Until the bug is fixed, `rgw_deployments` was changed to always skip tests over IBM Cloud, even if RGW deployments were found.

While attempting to cleanup underlying storage created within our test suit we encounter a problem where the bucket has not yet been emptied by MCG before we try to delete it.

We should address not empty buckets with a timeout sampler or force deletion of buckets before raising an exception.

title: Add capacity test consistently fails when it is done as part of tier1 post upgrade
body:
As noted by Harish recently in a chat thread about this kind of failure, the failure of add capacity is the second cluster expansion iteration, since we also have add capacity taking place prior to the upgrade. This means that this add capacity test, which is done as part of tier1 after upgrade, tries to add the 3rd OSD deviceset.The failure is because one of the new OSDs does not reach Running state and is stuck in Pending:

title: AttributeError: 'SanityExternalCluster' object has no attribute 'obc_objs'
body:
We are [expecting](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/helpers/sanity_helpers.py#L97-L98) `SanityExternalCluster` to have the attribute `obc_objs`, however this is [defined in the parent class](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/helpers/sanity_helpers.py#L31) `Sanity`. We do not define this in the [SanityExternalCluster init](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/helpers/sanity_helpers.py#L169-L176) or call the parent init so this attribute is never defined which results in the error below.

```
_______________________________ test_deployment ________________________________

pod_factory = <function pod_factory_fixture.<locals>.factory at 0x7f0ed23e3d08>

    @deployment
    @polarion_id(get_polarion_id())
    def test_deployment(pvc_factory, pod_factory):
        deploy = config.RUN["cli_params"].get("deploy")
        teardown = config.RUN["cli_params"].get("teardown")
        if not teardown or deploy:
            log.info("Verifying OCP cluster is running")
            assert is_cluster_running(config.ENV_DATA["cluster_path"])
            if not config.ENV_DATA["skip_ocs_deployment"]:
                ocs_registry_image = config.DEPLOYMENT.get("ocs_registry_image")
                ocs_install_verification(ocs_registry_image=ocs_registry_image)
    
                # Check basic cluster functionality by creating resources
                # (pools, storageclasses, PVCs, pods - both CephFS and RBD),
                # run IO and delete the resources
                if config.DEPLOYMENT["external_mode"]:
                    sanity_helpers = SanityExternalCluster()
                else:
                    sanity_helpers = Sanity()
                sanity_helpers.health_check()
>               sanity_helpers.delete_resources()

tests/ecosystem/deployment/test_deployment.py:33: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

        """
        Sanity validation - Delete resources (pods, PVCs and OBCs)

title: Must gather check needs to take into account operatorgroup naming scheme when OCS is installed via UI
body:
It seems that when OCS is installed via OCP Console, name of OperatorGroup object is different compared to ocs-ci automated cli driven installation.

## Details

Example of the naming scheme:

```
$ oc get operatorgroup
NAME                      AGE
openshift-storage-92ll4   3d16h
```

Which leads to the following files in must gather:

```
openshift-storage-92ll4-admin.yaml
openshift-storage-92ll4-edit.yaml
openshift-storage-92ll4-view.yaml
```

But ocs-ci must gather check looks for:

```
> Exception: Files don't exist:
> ['openshift-storage-operatorgroup-admin.yaml',
> 'openshift-storage-operatorgroup-edit.yaml',
> 'openshift-storage-operatorgroup-view.yaml']
```

Which is valid name when ocs-ci installed OCS in cli mode.

title: Several failures in the same test lead to log overwriting
body:
In cases where test X fails in the test itself, and then its teardown also fails, the must-gather logs we collect are being overwritten by the ones collected in the teardown.
This prevents us from having access to the logs of the problem that actually caused the test to fail.

title: pytest-ordering is not maintained anymore and contains a warning bug
body:
One of plugins we use, [pytest-ordering](https://github.com/ftobia/pytest-ordering), has ceased development about a year and a half ago.
A community member then created [pytest-order](https://github.com/mrbean-bremen/pytest-order), fixing many of the issues reported in `pytest-ordering`, including extra features, and also a fix for the warning we see in some of our runs - 
```
venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/_pytest/mark/structures.py:327
  /home/jenkins/workspace/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/ocs-ci/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/_pytest/mark/structures.py:327: PytestUnknownMarkWarning: Unknown pytest.mark.last - is this a typo?  You can register custom marks to avoid this warning - for details, see https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/mark.html
    PytestUnknownMarkWarning,
```

The warning is not critical, and does not affect code execution at all. It's mostly cosmetic.

`pytest-order` is *not* directly comaptible with `pytest-ordering`, because the marker name was changed from `run` to `order` - so this might not be an obvious change.

title: The pinned Paramiko version leads to a CryptographyDeprecationWarning
body:
Can be seen in our deployment runs -
```
tests/ecosystem/deployment/test_deployment.py::test_deployment
  /home/jenkins/workspace/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/ocs-ci/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/paramiko/kex_ecdh_nist.py:39: CryptographyDeprecationWarning: encode_point has been deprecated on EllipticCurvePublicNumbers and will be removed in a future version. Please use EllipticCurvePublicKey.public_bytes to obtain both compressed and uncompressed point encoding.
    m.add_string(self.Q_C.public_numbers().encode_point())
```

The issue was fixed in [version 2.5.0](https://www.paramiko.org/changelog.html#2.5.0)
We need to upgrade the pinned Paramiko version and make sure everything still works

title: A secondary solution to download OCP installer/client when release-artifacts is down
body:
At times, we experience downtime from https://openshift-release-artifacts.svc.ci.openshift.org.
That is something that interrupts the executions and forces us to have a local binary, as well as using in `run-ci`:
```
force_download_installer: False
force_download_client: False
```
We should look for a way for a cleaner approach, without forcing ourselves to pass additional config, in addition, when we experience downtime from release artifacts, deployment from Jenkins becomes unusable.

Some solutions we thought until now from offline discussions with @shyRozen and @ebenahar :

1) An internal HTTP server that will have both installer&client where we could easily download, when we see that release-artifacts website is down, we could have the server using cronjobs, to being updated with the latest installer&client binaries and pull them when it is possible.
With this approach, we need to maintain an HTTP server with those binaries accessible from some URL.

2) We could have them in ocs-ci, and update them with the latest binary once a while. (Will require to check if it is legal to have a copy of it in our repo)

3) We could create a container image with the tarballs in it, they could be downloaded to the Jenkins agent once we identify that release-artifacts is down, we could execute those containers temporarily on the Jenkins agent, and execute a sort of `docker cp` command from **the host**, and stop the containers.
With this approach, we will need to maintain an image on quay.io

How do you think we should continue with this problem?

title: Remove and fix inconsistencies in TimeoutSampler, add unit tests
body: Implementation of TimeoutSampler class contains few unexpected implementation details, this should be fixed, logging improved, while keeping the current api where it doesn't conflict with meaning of a timeout.

title: Increate limit for noobaa cpu utilization test
body: Since the CI test runs can't provide idle environment as expected by `test_mcg_cpu_usage` test case, we need to increase cpu utilization limit from 10% to 25%, which would cover common peak value of 15% seen in CI, but still safely caught BZ 1849309 regression. Original limit 10% was based on observation in actual idle state, and multiplied 10x.

title: Remove default values of master_instance_type

labels.name: platforms
labels.description: Related to support of deployment or test execution on particular platforms (baremetal, AWS, ...)

body:
Remove default value of `master_instance_type` from:
- [ ] `ocs_ci/framework/conf/default_config.yaml`
- [ ] `ocs_ci/templates/ocp-deployment/install-config-aws-upi.yaml.j2`
- [ ] `ocs_ci/templates/ocp-deployment/install-config-aws-ipi.yaml.j2`

And place the value into config files in `conf/deployment/aws/` in an explicit way, but so that we can override it via `conf/ocsci/aws_lower_resource_reqs.yaml` file. Maybe we should have `conf/ocsci/aws_default_resource_reqs.yaml` file which will be used by default for AWS.

There is no good reason to have AWS specific as a default. Moreover this makes it hard for auditing AWS deployment configuration just from looking at a config file.

This is a specific case of https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/issues/2523

title: hard coded ip address for codespeed server in constants.py for performance test test_pvc_deletion_performance.py::TestPVCDeletionPerformance::test_pvc_deletion_measurement_performance
body:
We have received the following error message during executing performance tests:
```
20:26:35 - MainThread - ocs_ci.utility.performance_dashboard - INFO - Trying to push {'json': '[{"commitid": "4.6.1", "project": "OCS4.6", "branch": "stable-4.6", "executable": "4.6", "benchmark": "cephfs-pvc-deletion-time", "environment": "BAREMETAL", "result_value": 2.920778}]'} to codespeed server:  http://10.0.78.167:8000/result/add/json/
20:28:45 - MainThread - ocs_ci.utility.performance_dashboard - ERROR - Failed to push data to codespeed, make sure the server is up
```

It seems that a codespeed server is required for performance tests. That isn't written down anywhere in the ocs-ci documentation. Alternatively, no codespeed server setup is integrated into the ocs-ci installation. Additionally, a internal IP address is preconfigured.

Path to the file with the hard coded ip address:
ocs_ci/ocs/constants.py:CODESPEED_URL = "http://10.0.78.167:8000/"

Used performance test:
tests/e2e/performance/test_pvc_deletion_performance.py::TestPVCDeletionPerformance::test_pvc_deletion_measurement_performance

title: Set all  "opsrc-" prefixed labels in ocs ci catalogsource
body:
## Description of the problem

OCS packagemanifest from rhceph-dev is missing "opsrc-" prefixed labels, which makes OCP Console to handle it as 3rd party operator. This is not optimal, because behaviour of OCP Console when using OCS CI builds may differ compared to stable released OCS builds.

Based on [evaludation from Boris Ranto](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1872335#c5), we need to:

> set these labels in your yaml that creates the catalogue source by defining the operator source and the labels there

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Install OCS via ocs-ci using CI builds from rhceph-dev org
1. Check that you have both stable and CI OCS Operator package manifests via
   `oc get packagemanifest | grep -i ocs-operator` (you should see 2 items)
1. Check labels on ocs packagemanifest resources:
   `$ oc get packagemanifest --show-labels | grep ocs-operator | grep opsrc-`

## Actual results

I have both stable 4.4.2 and latest CI 4.5.0 OCS operator package manifests as
expected:

```
$ oc get packagemanifest | grep -i ocs-operator
ocs-operator                                 Openshift Container Storage   31m
ocs-operator                                 Red Hat Operators             177m
```

But latest 4.5.0 CI OCS operator is missing opsrc- labels:

```
$ oc get packagemanifest --show-labels | grep ocs-operator | grep opsrc-
ocs-operator                                 Red Hat Operators             178m   catalog-namespace=openshift-marketplace,catalog=redhat-operators,olm-visibility=hidden,openshift-marketplace=true,operatorframework.io/arch.amd64=supported,operatorframework.io/os.linux=supported,opsrc-datastore=true,opsrc-owner-name=redhat-operators,opsrc-owner-namespace=openshift-marketplace,opsrc-provider=redhat,provider-url=,provider=Red Hat, Inc
```

There is only one (the stable OCS 4.4.2) ocs operator with
opsrc-provider=redhat label:

```
$ oc get packagemanifest -l opsrc-provider=redhat | grep ocs-operator
ocs-operator                        Red Hat Operators   179m
```

## Expected results

Both stable and CI OCS operators have opsrc-provider=redhat (and other opsrc-*)
labels:

```
$ oc get packagemanifest -l opsrc-provider=redhat | grep ocs-operator
ocs-operator                        Openshift Container Storage   31m
ocs-operator                        Red Hat Operators             179m
```

title: fix-3371 -- Add 5mins waittime after PVC deletion.

labels.name: Needs Testing
labels.description: Run tests and provide logs link

labels.name: Verified
labels.description: Mark when PR was verified and log provided

body:
The problem is in code should provide ample time for log generation to complete
During PVC deletion process, immediately after kube_job deletion we are collecting
CSI logs to capture PVC delete data.

With 10 or 100 no of PVCs logs are getting generated faster but when we perform delete
of 500/1000/2000 PVCs in bulk, immediately collecting logs missing PVC delete data.
Due to this reason in code list is getting empty data i.e. no respective PVC data in logs.
Fixing the problem by adding 5min wait time

Note: This is just a quick fix, better to have separate function to get the required timeout value based on PVC count.

Signed-off-by: Ramakrishnan <rperiyas@redhat.com>

labels.name: IBM Cloud
labels.description: For the issues/PR related to IBM Cloud

body:
tests/manage/z_cluster/nodes/test_nodes_maintenance.py::TestNodesMaintenance::test_node_maintenance[master]

The drain command failed to complete after 1200 seconds and 1 OSD + 1 mon are reported as down. 
The must gather dir structure is intact but the content is not there. 


Apparently, the cluster is co-located, in which each node serves as master and worker.
$ oc get nodeNAME STATUS ROLES AGE VERSION10.243.128.11 Ready master,worker 20d v1.18.3+47c0e7110.243.128.12 Ready master,worker 20d v1.18.3+47c0e7110.243.128.13 Ready master,worker 20d v1.18.3+47c0e71

This deployment way is not tested regularly and I don't recall when we a node drain operation was performed on such a cluster in our testing.I tried draining a node with the cluster Petr provided, it took around 1 hour to complete. In the automated test, the timeout is 1200 seconds for the oc adm command.

title: Fix indention problem for OCP install config templates

labels.name: Verified
labels.description: Mark when PR was verified and log provided

body:
Fixes: #3270

Signed-off-by: Petr Balogh <pbalogh@redhat.com>

title: OCP config installer template is not working well for 6 worker nodes cause of indention issue
body:
https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/14106/console
In this job we can see that config has wrong indent for replicas:
```yaml
compute:
  - name: worker
    platform:
      aws:
        type: m5.4xlarge
        zones:
          - us-east-2a
          - us-east-2b
          - us-east-2c
      replicas: 6
```

So when we have zones defined cause of indention in for loop block here:
https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/templates/ocp-deployment/install-config-aws-ipi.yaml.j2
Which we need to fix.

Working job:
https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/14177/console
```yaml
compute:
  - name: worker
    platform:
      aws:
        type: m5.4xlarge

title: In tier1 of post OCP upgrade, the config.ENV_DATA['ocs_version'] is N+1 instead of N
body:
As seen in `ocs-ci results for OCS4-6-Downstream-OCP4-6-VSPHERE-IPI-1AZ-RHCOS-VSAN-3M-3W-tier1 (BUILD ID: v4.6.0-148.ci RUN ID: 1603957359)` - http://magna002.ceph.redhat.com/ocsci-jenkins/openshift-clusters/j024ai3c33-uo/j024ai3c33-uo_20201030T125655/logs/run-1604206959-config.yaml 
This run is OCS 4.5.2 with upgrade of OCP from 4.5 to 4.6.
Post OCP upgrade, the OCS version in config.ENV_DATA['ocs_version']  is 4.6 instead of 4.5.

This causes failures in tests that check this value, like the setup phase of MCG tests, which adjust the Noobaa endpoint with the corresponding CR, as described here:

```
The Noobaa endpoints minCount and maxCount values are being changed prior to the MCG test cases. These values are being modified in either the Noobaa CR if the OCS cluster version is lower than 4.6 or in the StorageCluster CR, if the cluster version is 4.6 or above.

From the test logs, it's noticeable that the minCount and maxCount are being changed via the StorageCluster CR, which is not the correct method, since the OCS version is 4.5:

15:48:07 - MainThread - ocs_ci.ocs.ocp - INFO - Command: patch storagecluster ocs-storagecluster -n openshift-storage -p '{"spec":{"multiCloudGateway":{"endpoints":{"minCount":2}}}}' --type merge
15:48:07 - MainThread - ocs_ci.utility.utils - INFO - Executing command: oc -n openshift-storage --kubeconfig /home/jenkins/current-cluster-dir/openshift-cluster-dir/auth/kubeconfig patch storagecluster ocs-storagecluster -n openshift-storage -p '{"spec":{"multiCloudGateway":{"endpoints":{"minCount":2}}}}' --type merge
15:48:08 - MainThread - tests.conftest - INFO - Changing maximum Noobaa endpoints to 2
15:48:08 - MainThread - ocs_ci.ocs.ocp - INFO - Command: patch storagecluster ocs-storagecluster -n openshift-storage -p '{"spec":{"multiCloudGateway":{"endpoints":{"maxCount":2}}}}' --type merge
15:48:08 - MainThread - ocs_ci.utility.utils - INFO - Executing command: oc -n openshift-storage --kubeconfig /home/jenkins/current-cluster-dir/openshift-cluster-dir/auth/kubeconfig patch storagecluster ocs-storagecluster -n openshift-storage -p '{"spec":{"multiCloudGateway":{"endpoints":{"maxCount":2}}}}' --type merge


The OCS version is fetched from config.ENV_DATA['ocs_version'].
I looked at the run config post the OCP upgrade and saw the the value of this key is 4.6:

http://magna002.ceph.redhat.com/ocsci-jenkins/openshift-clusters/j024ai3c33-uo/j024ai3c33-uo_20201030T125655/logs/run-1604206959-config.yaml

ENV_DATA:
  ...
  ocs_version: '4.6'
```

title: test_delete_noobaa_resources[noobaa_core] doesn't work properly

labels.name: Medium Priority
labels.description: Fix this after High Priority tickets are fixed.

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
At the moment, `test_delete_noobaa_resources[noobaa_core]` consistently fails in our automation runs.
It seems related to the NooBaa service not returning to a healthy state quickly enough,
As part of the MCG status check, it instantiates an MCG object. As part of the init process, the class sends an RPC request to NB.
However, the returned value is HTML, and is obviously not JSON compatible, thus resulting in an exception and a failure of the test.
The error HTML seems to be the same one [mentioned here](https://discuss.konghq.com/t/route-and-path-matches-but-all-pods-are-down/2495), which is what leads me to suspect that the service just needs more time to return to normal.

title: Flexy deployment: UnboundLocalError: local variable 'err' referenced before assignment
body:
https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/13721

```
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 

self = <ocs_ci.deployment.flexy.FlexyAWSUPI object at 0x7f7f28dd7ba8>
log_level = 'INFO'

    def deploy(self, log_level=''):
        """
        build and invoke flexy deployer here
    
        Args:
            log_level (str): log level for flexy container
    
        """
        # Ignoring log_level for now as flexy
        # only works with 'debug' option
        if log_level:
            pass
        cmd = self.build_install_cmd()
        err = None
        # Ensure that flexy workdir will be copied to cluster dir even when
        # Flexy itself fails.
        try:
            self.run_container(cmd)
        except Exception as err:
            logger.error(err)
        self.flexy_post_processing()
>       if err:
E       UnboundLocalError: local variable 'err' referenced before assignment

ocs_ci/deployment/flexy.py:412: UnboundLocalError
```
Python [delete variable with assigned exception](https://docs.python.org/3.6/reference/compound_stmts.html#finally) (variable `err` is defined few lines before the `try ... except...` statement, but if any exception is raised, `err` variable is deleted.

title: cloud_uls_factory assumes that all cloud clients are provided in CloudManager

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
`CloudManager` is set to contain clients for cloud providers that are set in `AUTH`:
https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/4bf2986e037540c3fba363363a0a57f1332bf655/ocs_ci/ocs/resources/cloud_manager.py#L44

`cloud_uls_factory` expects that all clients are created (also those that are not in `AUTH`):
https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/e1632d6c6c134e37af7e7737960f0b2e69aeff1d/ocs_ci/ocs/resources/cloud_uls.py#L29

This leads to error when some credential in AUTH is missing:
```
(...)
request = <SubRequest 'cloud_uls_factory' for <Function test_namespace_resource_creation>>
cld_mgr = <ocs_ci.ocs.resources.cloud_manager.CloudManager object at 0x7ff9acb66128>

    def cloud_uls_factory(request, cld_mgr):
        """
        Create an Underlying Storage factory.
        Calling this fixture creates a new underlying storage(s).
    
        Args:
            request (object): Pytest built-in fixture
            cld_mgr (CloudManager): Cloud Manager object containing all connections to clouds
    
        Returns:
            func: Factory method - each call to this function creates
                an Underlying Storage factory
    
        """
        all_created_uls = {
            'aws': set(),
            'google': set(),
            'azure': set(),
            'ibmcos': set()
        }
    
        ulsMap = {
            'aws': cld_mgr.aws_client,
>           'google': cld_mgr.google_client,
            'azure': cld_mgr.azure_client,
            # TODO: Implement - 'ibmcos': cld_mgr.ibmcos_client
        }
E       AttributeError: 'CloudManager' object has no attribute 'google_client'

```

Their value to the QE team is just negative.

## Suggested solution

Create a new log level dedicated to reportportal log entries, so that:

- these log lines could be easily filtered out
- and stored separately (if necessary) for limited period of time (compared to normal test logs)

skipif_no_lso = pytest.mark.skipif(

)
```

title: `test_object_actions` behaves unexpectedly in OCS 4.6

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
One of the changes introduced in OCS 4.6 is that [the OBC owner account will have total control over the bucket](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1849771), regardless of any bucket policies.
However, many parts of the test rely on bucket policies blocking the account from performing various actions on the bucket.
This leads to a scenario in which an object is put in the bucket, then the object is deleted (the deletion should fail, but it succeeds because of the 4.6 change), and then an attempt to get it is made (which fails, because the object was deleted).

The logic will need to be rethought, or the test skipped in >4.5.
