title: Upgrade execution ordering is alphabetical and not according to the ordering markers
body:
1) The execution ordering is alphabetical and not according to the ordering markers, and it applies to all other test cases, not only add capacity.

All the tests that are under test/manage are being executed post upgrade, even though some of them have the '@pre_upgrade' marker. 
Also, since the upgrade tests themselves are alphabetical last under tests/ecosystem, all the pre and post upgrade tests that are under tests/ecosystem, are being called before the upgrade test.

For example:

tests/manage/monitoring/test_workload_with_distruptions.py::test_workload_with_checksum 
-------------------------------- live log setup --------------------------------
15:25:02 - MainThread - tests.conftest - INFO - Checking for Ceph Health OK 

This test has the `@pre_upgrade` mark:
While the upgrade test took place before that, started at 14:36:59.

2) The issue isn't new. 
Like in this run (OCS upgrade), from 25 days ago which is the oldest OCS upgrade run that still exists in Jenkins history.

From that run:

tests/ecosystem/upgrade/test_upgrade.py::test_upgrade 
-------------------------------- live log call ---------------------------------
10:19:11 - MainThread - ocs_ci.utility.utils - INFO - Executing command: oc -n openshift-storage --kubeconfig /home/jenkins/current-cluster-dir/openshift-cluster-dir/auth/kubeconfig get CephCluster  -n openshift-storage -o yaml

tests/manage/z_cluster/cluster_expansion/test_add_capacity.py::TestAddCapacityPreUpgrade::test_add_capacity_pre_upgrade 
-------------------------------- live log call ---------------------------------
10:56:20 - MainThread - ocs_ci.utility.utils - INFO - Executing command: oc -n openshift-storage --kubeconfig /home/jenkins/current-cluster-dir/openshift-cluster-dir/auth/kubeconfig get storagecluster  -n openshift-storage -o yaml

3) I tried executing with same markers (-m "pre_upgrade or ocs_upgrade or post_upgrade") from my laptop and the ordering worked well. 
The only difference between my laptop and the Jenkins slave is the Python version.
My laptop has python 3.7.9 and the Jenkins slave (from this run - #12485) has python 3.6.8.

Both my laptop and the slave also have:
pytest 5.3.5
py 1.9.0
pluggy 0.13.1
pytest-ordering 0.6

4) In the pytest ordering docs, it's mentioned that it's currently an alpha-quality software. 

========================================================================================================================================================

I wonder what could be the reason that the ordering is broken with the Jenkins slaves while it is working fine from my laptop. 
The only difference I could find is the Python version.

We need to find a solution quickly, as there are some test cases that lose their whole purpose if they are not being executed in the intended ordering. 
For example, test_workload_with_checksum and test_workload_with_checksum_verify, which do data integrity before and after an operation, upgrade in this case, and with the current issue both run after upgrade.

title: rewrite check_file_existence() function
body:
Function `check_file_existence()` uses:
- `which` tool to figure out if find is installed (and if not, installing findutils)
- find tool to figure out if a given file exists

It would make more sense if the function just used stat tool from coreutils, which would be less error prone, and also provide some useful details in debug log.

title: Fix usage of noobaa cli tool in ocs-ci tests

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

labels.name: MCG-4.11
labels.description: Issues that should be fixed as part of the MCG 4.11 coverage efforts

body:
I noticed that the way we use `noobaa` cli tool for tests is not optimal, and causes lot of issues.

I propose that to fix that, we need to have noobaa cli toolbox pod in a similar way we start ceph toolbox pod:

- we will have to create this pod themselves, reusing existing container image `noobaa-opeator` (we need to redefine at least it's entrypoint) which has the tool installed
- test cases will use the noobaa pod in a similar way how we use ceph toolbox pod

    def exec_cmd(cmd, secrets=None, timeout=600, ignore_error=False, **kwargs):
        """
        Run an arbitrary command locally
   
        Args:
            cmd (str): command to run
            secrets (list): A list of secrets to be masked with asterisks
                This kwarg is popped in order to not interfere with
                subprocess.run(``**kwargs``)
            timeout (int): Timeout for the command, defaults to 600 seconds.
            ignore_error (bool): True if ignore non zero return code and do not
                raise the exception.
   
        Raises:
            CommandFailed: In case the command execution fails
   
        Returns:
            (CompletedProcess) A CompletedProcess object of the command that was executed
            CompletedProcess attributes:
            args: The list or str args passed to run().
            returncode (str): The exit code of the process, negative for signals.
            stdout     (str): The standard output (None if not captured).
            stderr     (str): The standard error (None if not captured).
   
        """
        masked_cmd = mask_secrets(cmd, secrets)
        log.info(f"Executing command: {masked_cmd}")
        if isinstance(cmd, str):
            cmd = shlex.split(cmd)
        completed_process = subprocess.run(
            cmd,
            stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
            stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
            stdin=subprocess.PIPE,
            timeout=timeout,
            **kwargs
        )
        masked_stdout = mask_secrets(completed_process.stdout.decode(), secrets)
        if len(completed_process.stdout) > 0:
            log.debug(f"Command stdout: {masked_stdout}")
        else:
            log.debug("Command stdout is empty")
   
        masked_stderr = mask_secrets(completed_process.stderr.decode(), secrets)
        if len(completed_process.stderr) > 0:
            log.warning(f"Command stderr: {masked_stderr}")
        else:
            log.debug("Command stderr is empty")
        log.debug(f"Command return code: {completed_process.returncode}")
        if completed_process.returncode and not ignore_error:
>           raise CommandFailed(

title: route53 list_hosted_zones_by_name limited to 100 entries by default
body:
We are currently using the `list_hosted_zones_by_name` method of the `route53_client` in order to find the hosted zones that match the cluster we are tearing down. This call is limited (by default) to 100 entries. Furthermore it returns the list in ascii order so hosted zones that are sorted towards the end of that list will simply not be returned. We currently have 160 entries and as such may not retrieve the hosted zone for the cluster we are trying to tear down and incorrectly assume it does not exist.

We can utilize the `DNSName` and `MaxItems` parameters of this method to limit the entries we retrieve and ensure that we return the name of the hosted zone we are looking for if it exists. This should avoid the scenario where a hosted zone exists but we don't delete it simply because `list_hosted_zones_by_name` did not return it.

title: Code in ocs_ci module should not use assert statements
body:
Instead of assert statements, code in ocs_ci module should raise appropriate exception.

This way, code in ocs_ci or in the test can appropriately react on a failure, instead of a uncontrolled failure.

Added the marker for future uses - it isn't being used in this PR.

title: Fix issue with delete_cluster_buckets
body:
From #2549 

```    
        if http.status_code >= 300:
            error_code = parsed_response.get("Error", {}).get("Code")
            error_class = self.exceptions.from_code(error_code)
>           raise error_class(parsed_response, operation_name)
E           botocore.errorfactory.NoSuchBucket: An error occurred (NoSuchBucket) when calling the ListObjects operation: The specified bucket does not exist

.venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/botocore/client.py:635: NoSuchBucket
=============================== warnings summary ===============================
```

I don't think we should fail the upgrade if bucket not found but just continue here.

So re-opening this.

Job:
https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-destroy-ocs-cluster/7945/console



This is actually an issue with `delete_cluster_buckets` that was added [in this PR](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/2420/files)

body:
Title.

At the moment, the tests run regardless of platform - even on ones where RGW isn't deployed out of the box.

title: Error log shows all nodes did not reach the desired status despite individual node status
body:
Given below is the error log from ocs_ci.ocs.node.wait_for_nodes_status which lists all the nodes without considering the actual status of individual node. This error occurred when one node 'argo005.ceph.redhat.com' was not in Ready status, but other 2 nodes has reached the status Ready.

    def exec_cmd(cmd, secrets=None, timeout=600, ignore_error=False, **kwargs):
        """
        Run an arbitrary command locally

            stdout     (str): The standard output (None if not captured).

title: Failure in test_must_gather due to addition of new commands in must-gather
body:
Test `tests/manage/z_cluster/test_must_gather.py::TestMustGather::test_must_gather` is failing during tier 1 executions on OCS 4.5 builds with the following error:
```
E       AssertionError: Actual and expected commands output files are not matching.
E         Actual: ['ceph_pg_dump', 'ceph_report', 'ceph_osd_stat', 'ceph_osd_lspools', 'ceph_fs_subvolumegroup_ls_ocs-storagecluster-cephfilesystem', 'ceph_fs_ls', 'ceph_osd_crush_dump', 'ceph_quorum_status', 'ceph_config_dump', 'ceph_osd_crush_rule_ls', 'ceph_mon_dump', 'ceph_mgr_dump', 'ceph_device_ls', 'ceph_mgr_services', 'ceph_mds_stat', 'ceph_osd_dump', 'ceph_progress', 'ceph_df', 'ceph-volume_raw_list', 'ceph_osd_crush_rule_dump', 'ceph_status', 'ceph_fs_subvolume_ls_ocs-storagecluster-cephfilesystem_csi', 'ceph_health_detail', 'ceph_osd_utilization', 'ceph_balancer_status', 'ceph_service_dump', 'ceph_osd_numa-status', 'ceph_versions', 'ceph_auth_list', 'ceph_config-key_ls', 'ceph_osd_df_tree', 'ceph_osd_df', 'ceph_osd_crush_weight-set_dump', 'ceph_fs_dump', 'ceph_pg_stat', 'ceph_crash_stat', 'ceph_osd_getmaxosd', 'ceph_mon_stat', 'ceph_osd_perf', 'ceph_osd_tree', 'ceph_progress_json', 'pools_rbd_cbp-test-194c900639284a2b9ec3bd4df416f3b1', 'ceph_osd_blocked-by', 'ceph_osd_pool_ls_detail', 'ceph_fs_status', 'ceph_time-sync-status', 'ceph_mgr_module_ls', 'ceph_osd_crush_show-tunables', 'pools_rbd_ocs-storagecluster-cephblockpool', 'ceph_osd_crush_class_ls']
E         Expected: ['ceph_versions', 'ceph_status', 'ceph_report', 'ceph_pg_dump', 'ceph_osd_tree', 'ceph_osd_stat', 'ceph_osd_dump', 'ceph_osd_df_tree', 'ceph_osd_crush_show-tunables', 'ceph_osd_crush_dump', 'ceph_mon_stat', 'ceph_mon_dump', 'ceph_mgr_dump', 'ceph_mds_stat', 'ceph_health_detail', 'ceph_fs_ls', 'ceph_fs_dump', 'ceph_df', 'ceph_auth_list', 'ceph-volume_lvm_list']
.
.
.
```
Some new commands have been added to must gather via this [Bug 1847973](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1847973) and hence the failure.

Suggestions for improvement:
 - The test case should be able to handle this kind of change as there might be additional commands in the future
 - The test case should not fail if the actual command output files are greater than the expected files

This has to be fixed. @clacroix12 when you will deal with other issue, can you please take a look at this as well? Thanks

title: CredentialsRequest check times out and leaves bucket after running

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
The current 40 seconds dedicated to checking the credentials do not seem enough, thus leading to test failures because of timeouts.
Also, sometimes, buckets are left over after the check ran - we need to find a better way to check the credentials (preferably one that is also not dependent on bucket creation)

title: Move config value canonization into single place (config load functionality)
body:
Don't try to canonize config values in `config.ENV_DATA` dictionary in various places, eg. as in `ocs_ci/framework/pytest_customization/marks.py`:

```
config.ENV_DATA['platform'].lower()  == 'aws'
```

But do this canonization during loading of a config file into `config.ENV_DATA` dictionary, so that the rest of the code base don't have to do this again.

Current design is prone to errors and involves lot of duplication.

title: helpers.create_pod fails if PVC volume mode is block
Remove platform specific values from default_config.yaml file

labels.name: platforms
labels.description: Related to support of deployment or test execution on particular platforms (baremetal, AWS, ...)

body:
Right now, we have 3 different places where some default values for AWS platform are placed (global defaults in `ocs_ci/framework/conf/default_config.yaml`, j2 templates of openshift-installer config files `ocs_ci/templates/ocp-deployment/install-config-aws-*.yaml.j2` and actual deployment config files in `conf/deployment/aws/`).

To be able to support multiple platforms, we need to remove all platform specific values from list of global default values in default_config.yaml file.

## Example of use case which doesn't work

When I create the following config files for another cloud platform (eg. Azure):

- `ocs_ci/templates/ocp-deployment/install-config-azure-ipi.yaml.j2`
- `conf/deployment/azure/ipi_1az_rhcos_3m_3w.yaml`

The OCP installer is still trying to install with AWS defaults, which comes from default_config.yaml file.

title: test_add_node should improve logging in case of a failure
body:
Test case `tests/manage/z_cluster/cluster_expansion/test_node_expansion.py/TestAddNode/test_add_node` could include the following details in a log in case of a failure:

- list of machines and it's status (as in `oc get machines -n openshift-machine-api`)
- list of nodes and it's status (as in `oc get nodes`)
- total timeout in seconds (if the test failed on a timeout)

Right now, the test case reports status for machinesets only (via ` get machinesets  -n openshift-machine-api`), which is not sufficient for debugging possible machine scaling failure.

title: TimeoutSampler didn't finish after timeout expired
body: In [check that upgrade is finished](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/tests/ecosystem/upgrade/test_upgrade.py#L45) is used TimeoutSampler. Timeout is set to 750 seconds (12 minutes) but even after more than an hour there is no timeout exception.

errwrite = 22, restore_signals = True, start_new_session = False

    def _execute_child(self, args, executable, preexec_fn, close_fds,
                       pass_fds, cwd, env,
                       startupinfo, creationflags, shell,
                       p2cread, p2cwrite,
                       c2pread, c2pwrite,
                       errread, errwrite,
                       restore_signals, start_new_session):
        """Execute program (POSIX version)"""

        if isinstance(args, (str, bytes)):
            args = [args]
        else:
            args = list(args)

        if shell:
            # On Android the default shell is at '/system/bin/sh'.
            unix_shell = ('/system/bin/sh' if
                      hasattr(sys, 'getandroidapilevel') else '/bin/sh')
            args = [unix_shell, "-c"] + args
            if executable:
                args[0] = executable

        if executable is None:
            executable = args[0]
        orig_executable = executable

        # For transferring possible exec failure from child to parent.
        # Data format: "exception name:hex errno:description"
        # Pickle is not used; it is complex and involves memory allocation.
        errpipe_read, errpipe_write = os.pipe()
        # errpipe_write must not be in the standard io 0, 1, or 2 fd range.
        low_fds_to_close = []
        while errpipe_write < 3:
            low_fds_to_close.append(errpipe_write)
            errpipe_write = os.dup(errpipe_write)
        for low_fd in low_fds_to_close:
            os.close(low_fd)
        try:
            try:
                # We must avoid complex work that could involve
                # malloc or free in the child process to avoid
                # potential deadlocks, thus we do all this here.
                # and pass it to fork_exec()

                if env is not None:
                    env_list = []
                    for k, v in env.items():
                        k = os.fsencode(k)
                        if b'=' in k:
                            raise ValueError("illegal environment variable name")
                        env_list.append(k + b'=' + os.fsencode(v))
                else:
                    env_list = None  # Use execv instead of execve.
                executable = os.fsencode(executable)
                if os.path.dirname(executable):
                    executable_list = (executable,)
                else:
                    # This matches the behavior of os._execvpe().
                    executable_list = tuple(
                        os.path.join(os.fsencode(dir), executable)
                        for dir in os.get_exec_path(env))
                fds_to_keep = set(pass_fds)
                fds_to_keep.add(errpipe_write)
                self.pid = _posixsubprocess.fork_exec(
                        args, executable_list,
                        close_fds, tuple(sorted(map(int, fds_to_keep))),
                        cwd, env_list,
                        p2cread, p2cwrite, c2pread, c2pwrite,
                        errread, errwrite,
                        errpipe_read, errpipe_write,
                        restore_signals, start_new_session, preexec_fn)
                self._child_created = True
            finally:
                # be sure the FD is closed no matter what
                os.close(errpipe_write)

            # self._devnull is not always defined.
            devnull_fd = getattr(self, '_devnull', None)
            if p2cread != -1 and p2cwrite != -1 and p2cread != devnull_fd:
                os.close(p2cread)
            if c2pwrite != -1 and c2pread != -1 and c2pwrite != devnull_fd:
                os.close(c2pwrite)
            if errwrite != -1 and errread != -1 and errwrite != devnull_fd:
                os.close(errwrite)
            if devnull_fd is not None:
                os.close(devnull_fd)
            # Prevent a double close of these fds from __init__ on error.
            self._closed_child_pipe_fds = True

            # Wait for exec to fail or succeed; possibly raising an
            # exception (limited in size)
            errpipe_data = bytearray()
            while True:
                part = os.read(errpipe_read, 50000)
                errpipe_data += part
                if not part or len(errpipe_data) > 50000:
                    break
        finally:
            # be sure the FD is closed no matter what
            os.close(errpipe_read)

        if errpipe_data:
            try:
                pid, sts = os.waitpid(self.pid, 0)
                if pid == self.pid:
                    self._handle_exitstatus(sts)
                else:
                    self.returncode = sys.maxsize
            except ChildProcessError:
                pass

            try:
                exception_name, hex_errno, err_msg = (
                        errpipe_data.split(b':', 2))
                # The encoding here should match the encoding
                # written in by the subprocess implementations
                # like _posixsubprocess
                err_msg = err_msg.decode()
            except ValueError:
                exception_name = b'SubprocessError'
                hex_errno = b'0'
                err_msg = 'Bad exception data from child: {!r}'.format(
                              bytes(errpipe_data))
            child_exception_type = getattr(
                    builtins, exception_name.decode('ascii'),
                    SubprocessError)
            if issubclass(child_exception_type, OSError) and hex_errno:
                errno_num = int(hex_errno, 16)
                child_exec_never_called = (err_msg == "noexec")
                if child_exec_never_called:
                    err_msg = ""
                    # The error must be from chdir(cwd).
                    err_filename = cwd
                else:
                    err_filename = orig_executable
                if errno_num != 0:
                    err_msg = os.strerror(errno_num)
                    if errno_num == errno.ENOENT:
                        err_msg += ': ' + repr(err_filename)
>               raise child_exception_type(errno_num, err_msg, err_filename)

title: Destroy Cluster job failed on a cluster whose deployment was abnormally aborted
body:
I started a deployment job and then since it had an incorrect param specified, manually aborted it within some minutes. Then started a destroy job to delete the created resources, but the Destroy job is failing with following message:


```
>               f"Error during execution of command: {masked_cmd}."

E           Error is Unable to connect to the server: dial tcp 52.14.158.130:6443: i/o timeout

ocs_ci/utility/utils.py:462: CommandFailed

```

it is expected that oc get pods would fail as the cluster was aborted mid-way during deployment. But, Destroy job should still forcefully delete the half-made cluster.


Deploy job abnormally aborted:  https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/9189/

Destroy Job : https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-destroy-ocs-cluster/6984/console

title: Update of subscription should happen after updating catalogSource
Add root access via securityContext to pods that require it
body:
OCP 4.5 changes the default pod user from root to an underprivileged one.
This causes two known failures:
1. The `awscli_relay_pod` cannot create the `/cert/` dir required for the workaround. Fixed in #2272 
2. `test_deployment` and other tests that rely on our default NGINX pod fail because it enters a `CrashLoopBackOff` since it required root permissions. When I replaced the image with `nginxinc/nginx-unprivileged` it was not sufficient because we try to install `fio` and `git` on the pod as part of `fio.py` and `jenkins.py`.

Using the solution offered by @petr-balogh allows root access once more, and thus the issue title was changed.

title: fiojob workload_fio_storageutilization() function should extend timeout when used with with_checksum=True
body:
When `workload_fio_storageutilization()` is used with `with_checksum=True`, sha1sum tool starts to compute checksum of data when fio finishes writing it.

The problem is that the timeout for the whole k8s job is not updated, so that the job could fail during checksum computation.

This has been observed with `OSD_SIZE` 2048 in CI.

title: restart_ec2_instances() should directly call reboot_instances instead of doing stop and start
body:
We should directly call reboot_instances instead of stop and start.
AWS i3 based OCS deployment, cannot tolerate Node shutdown but can hold node restarts.
Due to the current way of AWS reboot, we are kind of doing shutdown(stop/start) due to which some of the test cases which involves node reboot are failing on AWS i3.

    def restart_ec2_instances(self, instances, wait=False, force=True):
        """
        Stop and start ec2 instances

        Args:
            instances (dict): A dictionary of instance IDs and names to restart
            wait (bool): True in case wait for status is needed,
                False otherwise
            force (bool): True for force instance stop, False otherwise

        """
        logger.info(f"Restarting instances {list(instances.values())}")
        self.stop_ec2_instances(instances=instances, wait=wait, force=force)
        self.start_ec2_instances(instances=instances, wait=wait)

ocs-ci results for OCS4-4-Downstream-OCP4-4-AWS-IPI-3AZ-RHCOS-LSO-3M-3W-workloads (BUILD ID: v4.4.0-420.ci RUN ID: 1589409630

title: Sequential Creation of PVC in AWS setup failes to Bound 2 out of 5 times.
body:
Observing this problem consistently during Scale test ocs-ci run for every build.

PVCs are created sequentially without waiting for it to Bound, later validating either PVC Bound or Not and there were failures reported as PVC not bound due to timeout, please note not observing this problem in vmware cluster.

The problem could be due to execution speed, with respect to vmware setup observing bit slowness in execution this leads to proving ample time for PVCs in csi queue and it's getting Bound.

So How to resolve this Problem ? Is it good to change the code like create a PVC wait for it Bound and create next ? or is there some other solution.

Recent aws test run:  https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/7484/testReport/junit/tests.e2e.scale.test_pvc_creation_deletion_scale/TestPVCCreationDeletionScale/test_multiple_pvc_creation_deletion_scale_ReadWriteOnce_CephBlockPool_/

Logs: http://magna002.ceph.redhat.com/ocsci-jenkins/openshift-clusters/jnk-ai3cl33-s/jnk-ai3cl33-s_20200513T203517/logs/failed_testcase_ocs_logs_1589405541/test_multiple_pvc_creation_deletion_scale%5bReadWriteMany-CephBlockPool%5d_ocs_logs/

title: Calculation of cluster throughput is always done according to 'B/s'
body:
In https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/409131fe26b48c9fcb4b259e255010a217bd8eb3/ocs_ci/ocs/cluster.py#L569

The conversion needs to be modified from 
```{'B/s': 0.000000976562, 'KiB/s': 0.000976562, 'MiB/s': 1}``` 
to
```{' B/s': 0.000000976562, ' KiB/s': 0.000976562, ' MiB/s': 1}``` 
as the comparison done below in this function always returns the value according to  'B/s'

title: PVC provisioning failied when using custom SC
body:
These test cases are failing in OCS4.2 cluster.

```
  - pv_services.test_change_reclaim_policy_of_pv.TestChangeReclaimPolicyOfPv::test_change_reclaim_policy_of_pv[CephBlockPool-Delete]
  - pv_services.test_change_reclaim_policy_of_pv.TestChangeReclaimPolicyOfPv::test_change_reclaim_policy_of_pv[CephBlockPool-Retain]
  - pv_services.test_change_reclaim_policy_of_pv.TestChangeReclaimPolicyOfPv::test_change_reclaim_policy_of_pv[CephFileSystem-Delete]
  - pv_services.test_change_reclaim_policy_of_pv.TestChangeReclaimPolicyOfPv::test_change_reclaim_policy_of_pv[CephFileSystem-Retain]
  - pv_services.test_dynamic_pvc_accessmodes_with_reclaim_policies.TestRWODynamicPvc::test_rwo_dynamic_pvc[CephBlockPool-Retain]
  - pv_services.test_dynamic_pvc_accessmodes_with_reclaim_policies.TestRWODynamicPvc::test_rwo_dynamic_pvc[CephBlockPool-Delete]
  - pv_services.test_dynamic_pvc_accessmodes_with_reclaim_policies.TestRWODynamicPvc::test_rwo_dynamic_pvc[CephFileSystem-Retain]
  - pv_services.test_dynamic_pvc_accessmodes_with_reclaim_policies.TestRWODynamicPvc::test_rwo_dynamic_pvc[CephFileSystem-Delete]
  - pv_services.test_dynamic_pvc_accessmodes_with_reclaim_policies.TestRWXDynamicPvc::test_rwx_dynamic_pvc[CephFileSystem-Retain]
  - pv_services.test_dynamic_pvc_accessmodes_with_reclaim_policies.TestRWXDynamicPvc::test_rwx_dynamic_pvc[CephFileSystem-Delete]
  - pv_services.test_raw_block_pv.TestRawBlockPV::test_raw_block_pv[Delete]
  - pv_services.test_raw_block_pv.TestRawBlockPV::test_raw_block_pv[Retain]
  - pv_services.test_reclaim_policy.TestReclaimPolicy::test_reclaim_policy_retain
  - pv_services.test_reclaim_policy.TestReclaimPolicy::test_reclaim_policy_delete
  - storageclass.test_rbd_csi_default_sc.TestBasicPVCOperations::test_ocs_347
```

Reason - PVC creation failed due to this error.

```
E             Type     Reason                Age                From                                                                                                                Message
E             ----     ------                ----               ----                                                                                                                -------
E             Warning  ProvisioningFailed    40s (x4 over 64s)  openshift-storage.rbd.csi.ceph.com_csi-rbdplugin-provisioner-745584dcf8-jllhf_0cc2022e-9301-11ea-9ab7-0a580a830013  failed to provision volume with StorageClass "storageclass-test-rbd-79b52ded403c40fca4182f263a52b29d": failed to strip CSI Parameters of prefixed keys: found unknown parameter key "csi.storage.k8s.io/controller-expand-secret-namespace" with reserved namespace csi.storage.k8s.io/
E             Normal   Provisioning          24s (x7 over 64s)  openshift-storage.rbd.csi.ceph.com_csi-rbdplugin-provisioner-745584dcf8-jllhf_0cc2022e-9301-11ea-9ab7-0a580a830013  External provisioner is provisioning volume for claim "namespace-test-b7d26ddf6dd2471d88154fe169aac691/pvc-test-6a16968250f54aaf82f4f2324391245d"
E             Warning  ProvisioningFailed    23s (x3 over 64s)  openshift-storage.rbd.csi.ceph.com_csi-rbdplugin-provisioner-745584dcf8-jllhf_0cc2022e-9301-11ea-9ab7-0a580a830013  failed to provision volume with StorageClass "storageclass-test-rbd-79b52ded403c40fca4182f263a52b29d": failed to strip CSI Parameters of prefixed keys: found unknown parameter key "csi.storage.k8s.io/controller-expand-secret-name" with reserved namespace csi.storage.k8s.io/
```

All these test cases use newly created storage class and the failure is due to the presence of "csi.storage.k8s.io/controller-expand-secret-name" and "csi.storage.k8s.io/controller-expand-secret-namespace" parameter in storage class. This was added in PR 1778. To run these test cases in OCS4.2, these parameters should not be added in storageclass yaml file.

This could be the case in OCS4.3 as well, but not tested. Anyway these parameters are not required for OCS4.3 , so it should be removed.

title: ocs_ci.ocs.cluster.CephCluster.get_throughput_percentage calculates based on EBS volumes and not suitable for other platforms
body: In https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/c1e4ccc03124ffc70d89c1916dabd8509c8d908c/ocs_ci/ocs/cluster.py#L579 we calculate the throughput percentage according to the EBS volume limit (250Mb/s) so this function isn't suitable for other platforms, like vsphere and also for other instances and EBS volumes sizes in AWS

title: tests/manage/pv_services/test_pv_creation should be fixed
body: tests/manage/pv_services/test_pv_creation teardown should move into the class TestPvCreation to ensure the teardown will not run when the test is skipped

title: Fix ceph *full ratio logging
body:
We are already logging ceph *full ratio values during storage utilization workload fixture runs, as proposed here: https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/issues/1809

But there is a problem with the way we obtain ration values: we should be checking osd map instead of a mon config, as [ceph docs notes](https://docs.ceph.com/docs/nautilus/rados/configuration/mon-config-ref/#storage-capacity):

> These settings only apply during cluster creation. Afterwards they need to be changed in the OSDMap using ceph osd set-nearfull-ratio and ceph osd set-full-ratio

To get the value from OSD map, Josh Durgin suggests to use `ceph osd dump`, in the same was as suggested by Umanga in https://github.com/openshift/ocs-operator/pull/413.

title: PR 1679 break functionality
body: https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/1679/files#diff-e2c2dcfab854db263b9a45a42d6f4b55R488 break functionality

title: Fixture measure_stop_ceph_osd should wait for osd to be back
body:
Fixture `measure_stop_ceph_osd` should wait for osd to be back so that cluster health is not affected.

While the osd is back quite fast, it's not consistent enough for other tests nor automatic health check, eg.:

- 2020-04-25 00:22:20,888 Upscaling deployment rook-ceph-osd-2 back to 1 (fixture)
- 2020-04-25 00:22:24,803 HEALTH_WARN 1 osds down ...                           
- 2020-04-25 00:22:26,136 HEALTH_WARN 1 osds down ...                           
- 2020-04-25 00:22:26,137 Ceph cluster health is not OK. Health: HEALTH_WARN 1 osds down ...
- 2020-04-25 00:22:57,484 Ceph cluster health is HEALTH_OK.

title: Improve implicit ceph healt checks
body:
We have recently introduced few implicit ceph health checks which makes sure that a cluster is not in invalid state. This is a good idea.

That said, when I run into a failure caused by one? of these checks, I see that the way this information is reported could be improved.

## Example of the problem

Eg. in a failure of negative test case which uses `measure_stop_ceph_osd`, I see that the end result of a testcase is a failure caused by following teardown exception:

```
E           ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.CephHealthException: Ceph cluster health is not OK. Health: HEALTH_WARN 1 osds down; 1 host (1 osds) down; 1 zone (1 osds) down; Degraded data redundancy: 525/1575 objects degraded (33.333%), 71 pgs degraded, 136 pgs undersized

ocs_ci/utility/utils.py:1318: CephHealthException
```

But when I check the logs itself, the very last log lines are:

```
2020-04-25 00:22:56,660 - INFO - ocs_ci.utility.utils.exec_cmd.433 - Executing command: oc -n openshift-storage exec rook-ceph-tools-74494c7b4b-dtp6k ceph health
2020-04-25 00:22:57,483 - DEBUG - ocs_ci.utility.utils.exec_cmd.446 - Command stdout: HEALTH_OK

2020-04-25 00:22:57,484 - DEBUG - ocs_ci.utility.utils.exec_cmd.454 - Command stderr is empty
2020-04-25 00:22:57,484 - DEBUG - ocs_ci.utility.utils.exec_cmd.455 - Command return code: 0
2020-04-25 00:22:57,484 - INFO - ocs_ci.utility.utils.ceph_health_check_base.1314 - Ceph cluster health is HEALTH_OK.
```
## Areas of improvement

- I don't see any info log line informing me that  ceph health validation started
- I don't see any info log line informing me that  ceph health validation ended (along with the result)
- From the exception, I don't know a timestamp of the failed ceph health check
- Neither do I see at which point was the exception raised
- One could be also puzzled why was the exception raised when the last ceph health check reported in the log is ok

title: Increase retries for cluster health function on test_monitoring_on_negative_scenarios
body:
Below monitoring test case failed with ceph cluster health is not OK.

tests/e2e/monitoring/test_monitoring_on_negative_scenarios.py::TestMonitoringBackedByOCS::test_monitoring_when_one_of_the_prometheus_node_down
tests/e2e/monitoring/test_monitoring_on_negative_scenarios.py::TestMonitoringBackedByOCS::test_monitoring_after_rebooting_node_where_mgr_is_running
tests/e2e/monitoring/test_monitoring_on_negative_scenarios.py::TestMonitoringBackedByOCS::test_monitoring_shutdown_and_recovery_prometheus_node

Error: ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.CephHealthException: Ceph cluster health is not OK. Health: HEALTH_WARN 1/3 mons down, quorum a,b

From the log, ~10 min it checked for the ceph cluster health and it failed but while running the next test case ceph cluster health was OK.

So increase retries while checking for cluster health

title: use 2 test functions instead of parametrization for test_capacity_workload_alerts
body:
Test function `test_capacity_workload_alerts()` implements 2 test cases (OCS-899 for RBD, OCS-1934 for CephFS) via parametrization, while and using both RBD and CephFS workload fixtures in both parametrization cases.

To make it more clear which workload is necessary in which case from reporting point of view, we need to use 2 test functions instead of parametrization here.

title: Configure fio workload storage utilization fixture to write into multiple files

title: Usages of strip() in ocs_ci.cleanup.aws.cleanup.get_clusters_to_delete should be replaced with replace()
body:
For some reason, in some cases, the cluster name is truncated in the wrong place of the cluster name string, which leads to the wrong cluster name being deleted and eventually leads to such a cluster to remain running.


See an example in this aws cleanup job run - https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-aws-cleanup/1157/consoleFull

Cluster originally named 'wusui-ocs-x25-dx8hv' is not being deleted even though it passed its allowed running time and the reason is that the cluster name processed by the cleanup is 'wusui-ocs-x25-dx8h'

Cluster name as seen in AWS web console:
![Screenshot from 2020-04-26 22-05-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6973523/80317071-482a3e80-880a-11ea-82d6-ed73aef67af7.png)

title: memory size of compute VM in DC26 is 8GB which is too low

When I try to deploy a new cluster in DC26 It failed because the memory was 8GB which is too low. 
When I tried to use the configuration file 'conf/deployment/vsphere/upi_1az_rhcos_vsan_3m_3w.yaml' which specify  this param: **compute_memory: '32768'** the compute VM still had 8GB instead of 32GB as specified in the file. Also, @OdedViner faced the same issue. title: OSDs distribution verification done in ocs_install_verification() false negatively fails for clusters deployed with multiple OSDs per node
body:
ocs_ci/ocs/resources/storage_cluster.py:242 checks for a single OSD per node. 
This wrongly fails in cases like:
- Clusters deployed with multiple OSDs per node, like with AWS i3en.2xlarge (as this instance has 2 directly attached NVMe drives, that both used in deployment)
- Using an existing cluster that has multiple OSDs per node, for PR validation. For instance:
https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/6594

```
        if not skip_osd_distribution_check:
            log.info("Verifying OSD's are distributed evenly across worker nodes")
            ocp_pod_obj = OCP(kind=constants.POD, namespace=namespace)
            osds = ocp_pod_obj.get(selector=constants.OSD_APP_LABEL)['items']
            node_names = [osd['spec']['nodeName'] for osd in osds]
            for node in node_names:
                assert not node_names.count(node) > 1, (
>                   "OSD's are not distributed evenly across worker nodes"
                )
E               AssertionError: OSD's are not distributed evenly across worker nodes

ocs_ci/ocs/resources/storage_cluster.py:243: AssertionError
```

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
def __init__(self, mcg, obc):
        """
        Initializer function
    
        Args:
            mcg (obj): Multi cloud gateway object
            obc (str): Name of the Object Bucket Claim
        """
        self.obc_name = obc
        self.namespace = config.ENV_DATA['cluster_namespace']
        obc_obj = OCP(namespace=self.namespace, kind='ObjectBucketClaim', resource_name=self.obc_name)
        obc_results = obc_obj.get()
        self.ob_name = obc_results.get('spec').get('ObjectBucketName')
        self.bucket_name = obc_results.get('spec').get('bucketName')
        ob_obj = OCP(namespace=self.namespace, kind='ObjectBucket', resource_name=self.ob_name).get()
>       self.obc_account = ob_obj.get('spec').get('additionalState').get('account')
E       AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get'





OBC is initialised immediately after creating it. In some cases it would be still in pending state which results in not getting the object bucket name and account.

title: Align metrics tests with change in behaviour in measure_stop_ceph_mon fixture
body:
Since recent change done in https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/1690/, `measure_stop_ceph_mon`  fixture no longer guarantees that the problem is happening during whole duration of the fixture, as reported via it's `start` and `stop` timestamps.

This makes test case `test_monitoring_shows_mon_down` fail, as it expects that the problem is happening during whole time range communicated by the fixture.

Based on CI analysis.

## Proposed solution

Fixture `test_monitoring_shows_mon_down` should communicate min. duration of the problem (for how long the test using it's data should expect the mon to be down), and the test then needs to use this information to run more specific checks.

title: Remove kubernetes from requirements so a version compatible with openshift is used
body:
We include both the `kubernetes` and `openshift` python packages in our setup.py requirements. When `openshift` changes the version it's dependent on, we will encounter issues. We should remove `kubernetes` entirely so that we get whatever version `openshift` calls for.

```
ERROR: openshift 0.11.0 has requirement kubernetes~=11.0, but you'll have kubernetes 10.0.1 which is incompatible.
```

title: MCG target buckets aren't removed as part of the cluster's teardown on AWS

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
Up until this point, we had no way to recognize which S3 bucket was created as part of which cluster deployment.
This lead to many leftover buckets that were not removed as part of the cluster teardown process, and caused us to reach our S3 limit more than once.
Now, the cluster's name is also part of the bucket name, which means it should be relatively easy to add them to the cleanup process.

The bucket naming scheme is as following:
`nb.<ID>.apps.<cluster_name>.qe.rh-ocs.com`
For example - a cluster named 'beneli-cluster' -
`nb.1584430734361.apps.beneli-cluster.qe.rh-ocs.com`

title: Teardown of a project could fail on a timeout when the deleted project has a running IO
body:
Deletion of a project/namespace with running IO could take more time than anticipated by ocs-ci teardown code, which could make project teardown fail, while the project still ends up deleted.

This is especially a problem when a test with IO is interrupted because of a timeout, and then consequent project delete fails as well. Increasing a  project teardown timeout should make the teardown more robust and prevent unnecessary failures polluting CI test results.

title: Bug - CSI_ENABLE_SNAPSHOTTER value check is not fetching deployment by name
body:
The code is looking at the order of deployments to get rook-ceph-operator deployment. The rook-ceph-operator deployment can be in any order in the list of deployments in csv. It is required to fetch the deployment with name instead of sticking to the structure of the output.

```
for pod_obj in provisioner_pods:
            pod_info = pod_obj.get()
            for container, image in get_images(data=pod_info).items():
                assert ('snapshot' not in container) and ('snapshot' not in image), (
                    f"Snapshot container is present in {pod_obj.name} pod. "
                    f"Container {container}. Image {image}"
                )
        assert {'name': 'CSI_ENABLE_SNAPSHOTTER', 'value': 'false'} in (
            ocs_csv.get()['spec']['install']['spec']['deployments'][0]['spec']['template']['spec']['containers'][0]['env']
>       ), "CSI_ENABLE_SNAPSHOTTER value is not set to 'false'."
E       AssertionError: CSI_ENABLE_SNAPSHOTTER value is not set to 'false'.```

title: Make a write timeout of workload_fio_storageutilization job configurable
body:
Since available storage resources can differ on different platforms and it's instances, we need to generalize write timeout used in workload_fio_storageutilization fixtures, so that:

- the fixtures won't fail on timeout as long as the expected write speed is achieved
- one can specify the timeout in a config file (based on performance expectations of the cluster)

title: Registry test modifies the user, which leads to other user permissions to readonly mode

labels.description: Fix this after High Priority tickets are fixed.

Registry [test case](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/tests/e2e/registry/test_registry_image_push_pull.py) execution creates user and adds roles to the user, during this operation other users permissions becomes read_only and they are not able to perform any write operation.

Observed this problem in cluster while executing [PR](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/1508) after above mentioned registry testcase.

title: Currently our VmWare DC are not able to handle production config

So for now I would go with setting up 32GB for compute nodes and 16GB for masters.

title: Deployments to vsphere stuck after initializing terraform work directory
body:
Multiple vsphere deployments have become stuck after initializing the terraform work directory. Jobs stuck at this point will remain here until aborted or until the jenkins slave is shut down. The nodes that have been brought up do not appear to be in a running state / created successfully by terraform so they will need to be cleaned up manually through the vsphere console. I have experienced this myself on multiple different datacenters so I know the issue isn't isolated to one. I am still unsure if it is a vsphere issue or a jenkins slave issue.

Logs while job is stuck:
```
18:09:45 - MainThread - ocs_ci.deployment.terraform - INFO - Initializing terraform work directory
18:09:45 - MainThread - ocs_ci.utility.utils - INFO - Executing command: terraform init /home/jenkins/workspace/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/ocs-ci/external/installer/upi/vsphere/
18:10:04 - MainThread - ocs_ci.utility.utils - INFO - Executing command: terraform apply '-var-file=/home/jenkins/current-cluster-dir/openshift-cluster-dir/terraform_data/terraform.tfvars' -auto-approve '/home/jenkins/workspace/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/ocs-ci/external/installer/upi/vsphere/'
```

After shutting down the jenkins slave:
```
Cannot contact temp-slave-jnk-pr1377-b976: hudson.remoting.ChannelClosedException: Channel "unknown": Remote call on temp-slave-jnk-pr1377-b976 failed. The channel is closing down or has closed down
```

Jenkins job: https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/4128/console

title: Misleading warning and error reported at the end of a test run
body:
When I execute a test case via ocs-ci, at the and of the log I see the following lines:

```
16:30:45 - MainThread - ocs_ci.ocs.ocp - WARNING - Failed to get resource: namespace-test-47b4cf16197941bd9a004243ae8deea6 of kind: Project, selector: None, Error: Error during execution of command: oc -n namespace-test-47b4cf16197941bd9a004243ae8deea6 --kubeconfig /home/ocsqe/data/cluster-2020-01-21.1/auth/kubeconfig get Project namespace-test-47b4cf16197941bd9a004243ae8deea6 -n namespace-test-47b4cf16197941bd9a004243ae8deea6 -o yaml.
Error is Error from server (NotFound): namespaces "namespace-test-47b4cf16197941bd9a004243ae8deea6" not found

16:30:45 - MainThread - ocs_ci.ocs.ocp - ERROR - Number of attempts to get resource reached!
16:30:45 - MainThread - ocs_ci.ocs.ocp - INFO - Project namespace-test-47b4cf16197941bd9a004243ae8deea6 got deleted successfully
```

Reporting a warning and an error because the namespace which is being deleted during the teardown is misleading. The code should not report error for an expected outcome. This increases a cost of debugging when something actually goes wrong.

title: Make sure workload_fio_storageutilization fixtures waits for the storage to be actually reclaimed
body: When test case(s) in a run use multiple different `workload_storageutilization_*` fixtures, it could happen that while OCS is still deleting data written by one just finished fixture, another storage utilization fixture is already started, thinking that there is a lot of data, but by the time it starts writing,  the space is finaly reclaimed so that the actual global utilization (based on a measurement when the utilization was still high because of the previous fixture) is nowhere near the expected target of the 2nd fixture.

title: Tests failing with missing ceph_pool attribute in storage class OCS object
body:
The below tests are failing because storage class OCS object does not have a ceph_pool attribute. With the change to use default storage class in tests, ceph_pool attribute is not added.

The tests has to be modified to get ceph block pool name using helpers.default_ceph_block_pool.

Affected tests:
ocs-ci/tests/manage/pv_services/test_ceph_daemon_kill_during_resource_deletion.py
ocs-ci/tests/manage/pv_services/test_resource_deletion_during_pod_pvc_deletion.py
ocs-ci/tests/manage/pv_services/test_resource_deletion_during_pvc_pod_deletion_and_io.py
ocs-ci/tests/manage/pv_services/test_daemon_kill_during_pvc_pod_deletion_and_io.py


Error Details 
AttributeError: 'OCS' object has no attribute 'ceph_pool'

```
        for pvc_name, uuid in pvc_uuid_map.items():
            if interface == constants.CEPHBLOCKPOOL:
                ret = verify_volume_deleted_in_backend(
                    interface=interface, image_uuid=uuid,
>                   pool_name=sc_obj.ceph_pool.name
                )
E               AttributeError: 'OCS' object has no attribute 'ceph_pool'
```

title: kubeconfig file is not accessible with aws upi installation
body:
When a Jenkins job is started with aws upi installation, kubeconfig file is inaccessible from the path provided. 

Looks like a sym link is created from installation path `/jenkins/workspace/qe-deploy-ocs-cluster/ocs-ci/external/openshift-misc-1578897268/v3-launch-templates/functionality-testing/aos-4_2/hosts/install-dir/auth/kubeconfig` to custer directory `/home/jenkins/current-cluster-dir/openshift-cluster-dir/auth/kubeconfig`.

However, the install path is deleted after the installation which leaves the kubeconfig file inaccessible. The contents of `auth` need to be copied instead of using a symlink.

title: test_jenkins_simulation.py should run the test on the ceph mountpoint
body:
test_jenkins_simulation.py runs the test on the pod's /root directory instead of the mount point from PVC attached. 

current implementation:
`oc -n namespace-test-5b09342044394556a3ea774271086f5c --kubeconfig /home/kramdoss/Downloads/kramdoss-cluster/auth/kubeconfig rsh pod-test-cephfs-51ab0148a9c0448ca876f82d14eecceb git clone --recursive https://github.com/ceph/ceph.git`

But This should actually be,
`oc -n namespace-test-5b09342044394556a3ea774271086f5c --kubeconfig /home/kramdoss/Downloads/kramdoss-cluster/auth/kubeconfig rsh pod-test-cephfs-51ab0148a9c0448ca876f82d14eecceb git clone --recursive https://github.com/ceph/ceph.git <mount_point>`

title: MCG object and AWSCLI pod instantiation is performed per-test instead of per-class/session

labels.name: Medium Priority
labels.description: Fix this after High Priority tickets are fixed.

labels.name: MCG
labels.description: Multi Cloud Gateway / NooBaa related issues

body:
This problem causes very long setup times for each and every tests, instead of reusing the same object over and over.

As part of solving this issue, we should also redesign a better dataset retrieval and interaction mechanisms. One of the things that blocks the usage of AWSCLI pod as a session fixture is the assumption that each test receives a fresh pod, thus downloading the dataset anew, and leaves many leftovers in many different directories throughout the test.

title: AWS UPI cluster teardown doesn't wait long enough for stacks to be deleted
body: As observed in [this destroy job](https://ocs4-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/qe-destroy-ocs-cluster/1935/console) we intermittently end up raising an exception during the teardown of the cluster when one of the stacks is still in the `DELETE_IN_PROGRESS` status. It seems as if some of the stacks are now taking more time than we were giving them in order to delete fully. We should increase the amount of retries we allow for while monitoring the stack statuses.

title: Deployment fails on Not enough worker nodes: 2 to label: 3 or taint: 0!
body:
## Description of the problem

When I try to deploy OCS cluster via ocs-ci (using default downstream config in AWS), the deployment fails with `Not enough worker nodes: 2 to label: 3 or taint: 0!` exception.

## Version

ocs-ci: 55f69f1

cluster:

```
cluster channel: stable-4.2
cluster version: 4.2.0-0.nightly-2019-10-30-152749
cluster image: registry.svc.ci.openshift.org/ocp/release@sha256:08754f5f48452edb6feed48b16b4a4e53804c33df47264f60b5c42a4be9093c7

storage namespace openshift-cluster-storage-operator
image quay.io/openshift-release-dev/ocp-v4.0-art-dev@sha256:3e1089ccb42d3373e9b1595cd47c9c4fd4f629f94f5c3edc2c6a4cf85db5f575
 * quay.io/openshift-release-dev/ocp-v4.0-art-dev@sha256:3e1089ccb42d3373e9b1595cd47c9c4fd4f629f94f5c3edc2c6a4cf85db5f575
```

No OCS component is listed, because OCS was not installed.

## Steps to reproduce

Use ocs-ci to install OCS cluster with default configuration:

```
$ run-ci --cluster-path ~/data/cluster-2019-10-31.1 --cluster-name mbukatov-ocsqe --deploy -m deployment
```

## Actual Results

The installation fails on:

```
self = <ocs_ci.deployment.aws.AWSIPI object at 0x7f35feacd990>

    def label_and_taint_nodes(self):
        """
        Label and taint worker nodes to be used by OCS operator
        """
    
        nodes = ocp.OCP(kind='node').get().get('items', [])
        worker_nodes = [
            node for node in nodes if "node-role.kubernetes.io/worker"
            in node['metadata']['labels']
        ]
        if not worker_nodes:
            raise UnavailableResourceException("No worker node found!")
        to_label = config.DEPLOYMENT.get('ocs_operator_nodes_to_label', 3)
        to_taint = config.DEPLOYMENT.get('ocs_operator_nodes_to_taint', 0)
        worker_count = len(worker_nodes)
        if worker_count < to_label or worker_count < to_taint:
            logger.info(f"All nodes: {nodes}")
            logger.info(f"Worker nodes: {worker_nodes}")
            raise UnavailableResourceException(
>               f"Not enough worker nodes: {worker_count} to label: "
                f"{to_label} or taint: {to_taint}!"
            )
E           ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.UnavailableResourceException: Not enough worker nodes: 2 to label: 3 or taint: 0!

ocs_ci/deployment/deployment.py:132: UnavailableResourceException
```

And OCS is not installed on OCP cluster.

When I check number of worker noted, I see only 2:

```
$ oc get nodes
NAME                                         STATUS   ROLES    AGE   VERSION
ip-10-0-134-141.us-east-2.compute.internal   Ready    worker   31m   v1.14.6+0ec926dcc
ip-10-0-142-205.us-east-2.compute.internal   Ready    master   36m   v1.14.6+0ec926dcc
ip-10-0-144-66.us-east-2.compute.internal    Ready    master   36m   v1.14.6+0ec926dcc
ip-10-0-159-185.us-east-2.compute.internal   Ready    worker   31m   v1.14.6+0ec926dcc
ip-10-0-163-198.us-east-2.compute.internal   Ready    master   36m   v1.14.6+0ec926dcc
```

## Expected Results

I see 3 worker nodes, so that OCS is installed.

title: Installation fails on pods "alertmanager-main-0" not found
body:
When I use ocs-ci to deploy OCS cluster in AWS (with default downstream configuration), the deployment fails on  `pods "alertmanager-main-0" not found` error.

That said, I see that the alermanager pods are running:

```
$ oc get pods --all-namespaces | grep alertmanager
openshift-monitoring                                    alertmanager-main-0                                                   3/3     Running     0          49m
openshift-monitoring                                    alertmanager-main-1                                                   3/3     Running     0          49m
openshift-monitoring                                    alertmanager-main-2                                                   3/3     Running     0          49m
```

We need to look into this to see if this is a ocs-ci or a product bug. This problem could also affects results in CI in a negative way.

See full traceback in gist: https://gist.github.com/mbukatov/9287daffc1bb79d225946d45b64feb27

ocs-ci version: commit fba3174

title: aws_platform_required marker checks only upper-case 'AWS'
body:
Marker `aws_platform_required` expects value of `platform` to be set in upper-case `AWS`, but on some other places it is used as lower-case.

The definition of the [aws_platform_required](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/framework/pytest_customization/marks.py#L62:L65) looks like this:
```python
aws_platform_required = pytest.mark.skipif(
    config.ENV_DATA['platform'] != 'AWS',
    reason="Tests are not running on AWS deployed cluster"
)
```
In [deployment/ocp.p](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/ocs_ci/deployment/ocp.py#L29) it is used as `config.ENV_DATA['platform'].lower()` and also in some configuration files is *platform* set to `aws` (lower-case), e.g.: 
* [ocs_basic_install.yml](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/conf/ocs_basic_install.yml#L7)
* [aws_ipi.yaml](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/conf/ocsci/aws_ipi.yaml#L3)
* [production-aws-ipi.yaml](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/conf/ocsci/production-aws-ipi.yaml#L3)

So the marker will not work properly.

title: ValueError when iterating over generator returned from load_yaml with multi_document=True
body:
When attempting to iterate over the generator returned from `templating.load_yaml`, I am seeing the following error:

` ValueError: I/O operation on closed file.`

This is only happening when `multi_document=True` and when we are loading a local file (not from a url).

I was able to circumvent this issue by casting the generator to a list before returning it to the caller. Iterating over the list provides the dictionaries properly and does not return the error.

Output of local testing of load_yaml with a multi_document yaml file:
```

title: Teardown fails on missing metadata.json file
body:
## Description

When I tried to run teardown of a cluster, the process failed on `FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/ocsqe/data/cluster-2019-10-01.1/metadata.json'`.

This is a regression.

## Version

I used ocs-ci commit e070975

## Reproducer

1) I recreated python virtualenv and reinstalled ocs-ci
2) I deployed a downstream cluster via run-ci as usual:

```
$ run-ci --cluster-conf conf/ocsci/downstream_config.yaml --cluster-path ~/data/cluster-2019-10-01.1 --cluster-name mbukatov-ocsqe --deploy -m deployment | tee ~/data/cluster-2019-10-01.1.deploy.log
```
3) I used the cluster for a while.
4) I started a teardown of the cluster via:

```
$ run-ci --cluster-path ~/data/cluster-2019-10-01.1 --teardown -m deployment | tee ~/data/cluster-2019-10-01.1.teardown.log
```

## Actual Results

The process failed on:

```
20:23:28 - MainThread - ocs_ci.deployment.aws - ERROR - Traceback (most recent call last):
                                                          File "/home/ocsqe/projects/ocs-ci-deploy/ocs_ci/deployment/aws.py", line 110, in destroy_volumes
                                                            cluster_name = get_cluster_name(self.cluster_path)
                                                          File "/home/ocsqe/projects/ocs-ci-deploy/ocs_ci/deployment/aws.py", line 399, in get_cluster_name
                                                            with open(metadata_file) as f:
                                                        FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/ocsqe/data/cluster-2019-10-01.1/metadata.json'


================ 1 passed, 190 deselected in 458.77s (0:07:38) =================
```

The cluster directory ~is~ looks now empty, there is just a ocp install log left:

```
$ ls -la ~/data/cluster-2019-10-01.1
total 196
drwxrwxr-x. 2 ocsqe ocsqe     36 Oct  1 20:23 .
drwxrwxr-x. 4 ocsqe ocsqe  16384 Oct  1 20:47 ..
-rw-rw-r--. 1 ocsqe ocsqe 179249 Oct  1 20:23 .openshift_install.log
```

## Expected results

The teardown run finishes with success.

Cluster directory `~/data/cluster-2019-10-01.1` is not completely empty.

title: ocs-ci should use ceph toolbox image as provided by OCS
body:
Since https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/823 ocs-ci creates a ceph toolbox pod. But the problem is that when I deploy a downstream cluster via ocs-ci, the upstream ceph image is used for the toolbox pod:

```
$ oc describe -n openshift-storage pod/rook-ceph-tools-754fbcbf58-mg58c | grep docker
    Image ID:      docker.io/rook/ceph@sha256:11fd2a7d95962971a121ccc27e3d2019de381b6e7feb42ff2e5553bb1757bad1
```

We should make sure that the toolbox image uses ceph image which matches other ceph containers used by OCS (downstream for downstream cluster, the same ceph build, ...).

title: Cluster with name prefix ocs* already exists when not passing --cluster-name
body:
I am attempting to execute a deployment without passing `--cluster-name` and therefore using the default constructed `cluster_name`. I am seeing the below Exception being raised, apparently due to the prefix `ocs*` already being used.

By default `cluster_name = f"ocs-ci-{getuser()[:8]}"`. This entire string should be used to find non-terminated instances and not just `ocs`. As it currently works, if there is a cluster up and running in AWS that used the default `cluster_name`, no one will be able to execute a deployment using the default `cluster_name`. 

```
self = <ocs_ci.deployment.aws.AWSIPI object at 0x10b6ea908>, log_cli_level = 'INFO'

    def deploy_ocp(self, log_cli_level='DEBUG'):
        """
        Deployment specific to OCP cluster on this platform

        Args:
            log_cli_level (str): openshift installer's log level
                (default: "DEBUG")
        """
        if not config.DEPLOYMENT.get('force_deploy_multiple_clusters'):
            cluster_name = config.ENV_DATA['cluster_name']
            prefix = cluster_name.split("-")[0] + '*'
            if self.check_cluster_existence(prefix):
                raise SameNamePrefixClusterAlreadyExistsException(
>                   f"Cluster with name prefix {prefix} already exists. "
                    f"Please destroy the existing cluster for a new cluster deployment"
                )
E               ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.SameNamePrefixClusterAlreadyExistsException: Cluster with name prefix ocs* already exists. Please destroy the existing cluster for a new cluster deployment

ocs_ci/deployment/aws.py:151: SameNamePrefixClusterAlreadyExistsException
```

title: ERROR - Non terminated EC2 instances with the same name prefix were found []
body:
The new check for existing cluster with the same name prefix introduced in PR https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/780 and https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/801 prints unclear *ERROR* message even when there is no existing instances:

```
$ run-ci tests/ecosystem/ -m deployment --cluster-name dahorak-test --cluster-path clusters/dahorak-test --deploy
    <<truncated>>
08:13:38 - MainThread - botocore.credentials - INFO - Found credentials in shared credentials file: ~/.aws/credentials
08:13:39 - MainThread - ocs_ci.deployment.aws - ERROR - Non terminated EC2 instances with the same name prefix were found []
    <<truncated>>
```

The ERROR level of the message brings it to attention and the sentence suggest, that there are some non terminated instances, but the list seems to be empty and installation works as expected.

title: Check get_status_after_execution() fails seemingly by random because of reources in openshift-marketplace namespace
body:
It seems that new resources created by operators could make a test case fail seemingly by random.

## Example of the problem

After deployment, I executed `test_rwo_dynamic_pvc[CephBlockPool-Delete]` alone, which passed but then failed out of sudden on `ResourceLeftoversException`, which complained about resource from `openshift-marketplace` namespace, out of control of the test case:

```
>               f"\nThere are leftovers in the environment after test case:"
                f"\nResources added:\n{yaml.dump(leftovers['Leftovers added'])}"
                f"\nResources "
                f"removed:\n {yaml.dump(leftovers['Leftovers removed'])}"
            )

E                     \    \"interface\": \"eth0\",\n    \"ips\": [\n        \"10.128.2.18\"\n\
E                     \    ],\n    \"default\": true,\n    \"dns\": {}\n}]"

E                   openshift.io/scc: restricted
E                 creationTimestamp: '2019-09-23T12:53:13Z'
E                 generateName: community-operators-74f57b97dd-
E                 labels:

E                   kind: ReplicaSet

Also, added check for underlying PV delete once all PVCs are deleted.
@jilju thanks for the help :)

title: Fix for varying_ceph_size in backend_pool test

labels.name: Verified
labels.description: Mark when PR was verified and log provided

body: Issue #757

title: ceph_size_varying fix in test_pvc_delete_verify_size_is_returned_to_backendpool.py
body:
def check_ceph_used_space():
        """
        Check for the used space in cluster
        """
        ct_pod = pod.get_ceph_tools_pod()
        ceph_status = ct_pod.exec_ceph_cmd(ceph_cmd="ceph status")
        assert ceph_status is not None
        used = ceph_status['pgmap']['bytes_used']
        used_in_gb = used / constants.GB
        global used_space
        if used_space and used_space == used_in_gb:
            return used_in_gb
        used_space = used_in_gb
        raise UnexpectedBehaviour(
>           f"In Ceph status, used size is varying"
        )
E       ocs_ci.ocs.exceptions.UnexpectedBehaviour: In Ceph status, used size is varying

This test case passes consistently in local setup. But it is flaky in jenkins, may be because of the environment, leftovers from other test cases which affects the used_size, etc.
 
Reason:
"ceph status" or any ceph commands which returns the used_size does not show exact size immediately after creating/deleting rbd-images/pools etc.
For ex: In this test case we used to create a pvc and write 10GB of data after attaching a pod. In Ceph backend, it stores 30 GB (10*repliication(3)) on OSDs. Ceph status keeps on updating this used_size in intervals, we query "ceph status" for used_size(it varies in bytes) and after reaching max retries it errors out saying "used size is varying".

Solutions:
1. Increasing the delay/retires - Not recommended, since it is not possible to predict when the ceph status exact used size. As the number of tier1 test cases which creates pvc/pods increases, delay would vary. 

2. Reduce the IOs written on pod in this script: Reducing the IOs on pod results in quicker deletion and reflects the size sooner. Reducing the IOs does not impact the functionality. 

3. Changing from "ceph status" to "rados df -p <pool-name>": Based on my testing, using the later command is more accurate since it negates other pools created by different tests.

title: Logging issues wrt debugging of the recent failures in OCS-530 test case
body:
Logging in ocs-ci could be improved, to prevent the following problems related to debugging of OCS-530 test case:

* Debugging of this failure test was not possible based solely on logs stored by jenkins
* Debugging of the failure was much more expensive than necessary given the root cause of the problem.

While we can't guarantee that every failure will be always visible enough in the logs for us to understand what is wrong just from the logs, improving logging in this area is a good investment, as it makes future log analysis faster. It will also increase our confidence in the CI result.

## Related issues

* https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/issues/591
* https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/issues/612

## Core issues to be addressed

- add logging to `wait_for_resource` in ocp.py
- raise useful information in the exception in `validate_pv_delete`

title: Audit rook deployment automated in ocs-ci, focusing on prometheus monitoring setup
body:
Right now, when I deploy a cluster via ocs-ci, the ceph mgr prometheus target is not connected to openshift prometheus, and so no ceph metrics are available in prometheus.

Areas to focus on:

- [X] namespace workaround is not tracked, audit ocs-ci for additional workarounds (additional work because of #458 unresolved status): see  #469

     - diff on cluster.yaml (rook 81dde4b3 vs ocs-ci ec13283) looks ok (thanks to #460)
     - I need to set `monitoring_enabled` to True
- [X] servicemonitor manifest (`service-monitor.yaml`)
     - diff (rook 81dde4b3 vs ocs-ci ec13283) looks ok

title: Pod creation fails - KeyError: 'nodeName'
Deployment logging fix

labels.name: Verified
labels.description: Mark when PR was verified and log provided

body:
This PR addresses the issues documented in #436. I still wasn't able to determine with 100% certainty what the cause of the issues was, although I highly suspect it was some combination of setting the log_dir through `--logging-logsdir` as well as defining `pytest_logger_logdirlink` in our `conftest.py` which enables symlinking our logs. 

- Removed sym linking of pytest logs
- Moved log directory path construction to utility method
- Removed explicit call to create the log directory as pytest handles this for us

Fixes: #436 

Signed-off-by: Coady LaCroix <clacroix@redhat.com>

title: Fix import of delete_all_pvcs
body: Change approach for PVCs fixtures and not using globals for them.

title: conftest: Fix teardown finalizer
body:
We broke the teardown finalizer recently, by calling the function
immediately and causing None to be passed to addfinalizer(), resulting
in `TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not callable`
Caused by: https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/commit/b21121bf0103a813a582f24196fe21fcc1a6e623#diff-484462fced51d1a06b1d93b4a44dd535R93

Signed-off-by: Zack Cerza <zack@redhat.com>

title: Destroy cluster in bad shape

labels.name: Verified
labels.description: Mark when PR was verified and log provided

body:
We cannot collect data like version info from the cluster when it's not
in good shape. So when destroy cluster, we just skip the version
collecting with change in this PR.

Should also fix the issue #335

title: Deployment is broken because of https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/230
Parameter run_id not confiugred since PR #306 was merged
body:
Previously `RUN['run_id']` configuration was set in `ocs_ci/framework/pytest_customization/ocsci_logging.py` module[1] but it was removed as part of PR https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/306. Now `run_id` is not set and is reported as `None`.

For example Subject of yesterday's email report looks like this:
`  ocs-ci results for RUN ID: 1562075179`
while today it looks like this: 
`  ocs-ci results for RUN ID: None`

[1] https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/pull/306/files#diff-2547b2f6dfcb493a6faafa4ea30af013L13

title: teardown reports "Error" when a half-installed cluster is destoyed
body:
Description:

There are scenarios when "deployment" of a cluster fails due to some resource constraints(VPC limit, load balancer limit) , etc.

In the event of above failure, if we initiate teardown of the said cluster, even though teardown finally succeeds, the run fails with following error message:

```
09:22:19 - MainThread - ocs_ci.ocs.openshift_ops - ERROR - Cluster is not ready to use: Error during execution of command: ['oc', 'cluster-info'].
                                                           Error is Unable to connect to the server: dial tcp: lookup api.nberry-jul2-1.qe.rh-ocs.com on 10.75.5.25:53: no such host
FAILED         

```

But as the OC cluster was not up , its expected  not to get any output for "cluster-info" command. Hence, we should handle this and not fail the test run with "--teardown"

title: Need change in yaml files in OCS deployment and csi based files
body:
Description:
Due to the merged changes in CSI based yamls on  [rook git repo](https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/master/cluster/examples/kubernetes/ceph/), there are modified yamls for the following. Accordingly, we would have to change our deployment templates in OCS-CI.

Files used for chnage in ocs-ci repo copied from :
PR merged in rook repo (update rook to use ceph-csi canary version): https://github.com/rook/rook/pull/3324/files
PR Waiting to be merged in rook - https://github.com/rook/rook/pull/3358/files

1. Operator-openshift-with-csi.yaml 
2. RBD -  storageclass.yaml , snapshot.yaml and secret.yaml
3. Ceph FS - storageclass.yaml, secret.yaml
3. RBAC files in rbd and cephfs 


Bug list:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1724179

title: log files are not being generated for deployment
body:
I ran a deployment and the only log file that was included in my logs directory was for the minimal cluster connectivity test. No log files for the actual deployment were included in the log directory.
```
➜  logs_1561570272 tree
.
└── tests
    └── ecosystem
        └── deployment
            └── test_ocs_basic_install
                └── test_cluster_is_running
                    └── test_cluster_is_running.log

5 directories, 1 file
```
That log file includes the following:
```
2019-06-26 11:04:33,753 - INFO - ocs_ci.ocs.openshift_ops.set_kubeconfig.139 - Testing access to cluster with /Users/clacroix/clusters/rework-2/auth/kubeconfig
2019-06-26 11:04:33,754 - INFO - ocs_ci.utility.utils.run_cmd.361 - Executing command: oc cluster-info
2019-06-26 11:04:34,255 - DEBUG - ocs_ci.utility.utils.run_cmd.371 - CMD output: Kubernetes master is running at https://api.clacroix.qe.rh-ocs.com:6443

To further debug and diagnose cluster problems, use 'kubectl cluster-info dump'.

2019-06-26 11:04:34,255 - INFO - ocs_ci.ocs.openshift_ops.set_kubeconfig.151 - Access to cluster is OK!
```

I suspect this issue stems from the fact our deployment is now a fixture, and this issue possibly extends to all other fixtures that include some logging we would want to have in our log directory at the end of an automation run.

title: Change of project before the execution will break a lot of tests.
body:
Found the issue that if you change project to default or some other before execution like `oc project default` than some tests will fail as you can see:

```python
test_cephfilesystem_creation
tests.test_add_mds_to_cluster.TestCephFilesystemCreation
Time Taken: 56.03s
Failed: test teardown failure
def finalizer():
>       teardown(self)

tests/test_add_mds_to_cluster.py:30: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
tests/test_add_mds_to_cluster.py:50: in teardown
    self.fs_data = CEPHFS.get(defaults.CEPHFILESYSTEM_NAME)
ocs/ocp.py:102: in get
    return self.exec_oc_cmd(command)
ocs/ocp.py:66: in exec_oc_cmd
    out = run_cmd(cmd=oc_cmd)
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

cmd = ['oc', '--kubeconfig', '/Users/pbalogh/tmp/cluseters/pbalogh-us3-master/auth/kubeconfig', 'get', 'CephFileSystem', 'ocsci-cephfs', ...]
kwargs = {}
r = CompletedProcess(args=['oc', '--kubeconfig', '/Users/pbalogh/tmp/cluseters/pbalogh-us3-master/auth/kubeconfig', 'get',...urncode=1, stdout=b'', stderr=b'Error from server (NotFound): cephfilesystems.ceph.rook.io "ocsci-cephfs" not found\n')

    def run_cmd(cmd, **kwargs):
        """
        Run an arbitrary command locally
    
        Args:
            cmd (str): command to run
    
        Raises:
            CommandFailed: In case the command execution fails
    
        Returns:
            (str) Decoded stdout of command
    
        """
        log.info(f"Executing command: {cmd}")
        if isinstance(cmd, str):
            cmd = shlex.split(cmd)
        r = subprocess.run(
            cmd,
            stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
            stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
            stdin=subprocess.PIPE,
            **kwargs
        )
        log.debug(f"CMD output: {r.stdout.decode()}")
        if r.stderr:
            log.error(f"CMD error:: {r.stderr.decode()}")
        if r.returncode:
            raise CommandFailed(
>               f"Error during execution of command: {cmd}."
                f"\nError is {r.stderr.decode()}"
            )
E           ocs.exceptions.CommandFailed: Error during execution of command: ['oc', '--kubeconfig', '/Users/pbalogh/tmp/cluseters/pbalogh-us3-master/auth/kubeconfig', 'get', 'CephFileSystem', 'ocsci-cephfs', '-o', 'yaml'].
E           Error is Error from server (NotFound): cephfilesystems.ceph.rook.io "ocsci-cephfs" not found

utility/utils.py:376: CommandFailed
```

This happens if we don't pass namespace to the oc commands which is done for example when initializing object `OCP` from ocs/ocp.py module and the result is as you can see above.

Once project changed to openshift-storage, the testcase passed.

Here you can see output from oc command if I am on default project and if I specify namespace or don't specify.

```bash
# specified namespace
(master) $  oc -n openshift-storage get CephFileSystem ocsci-cephfs -o yaml
apiVersion: ceph.rook.io/v1
kind: CephFilesystem
metadata:

  generation: 3
  name: ocsci-cephfs
  namespace: openshift-storage
  resourceVersion: "44242"
  selfLink: /apis/ceph.rook.io/v1/namespaces/openshift-storage/cephfilesystems/ocsci-cephfs

title: Most of tests doesn't work because global state in defaults is not preserved
body:
I tried to run all tests (via `-m polarion_id tests/`) and it turns out that most of the test doesn't work. One reason behind this is the fact that the test code expects the defaults to be unmutable, but every other test actually changes it.

This leads to problems like:

```
self = <tests.manage.test_ocs_336_346.TestOSCBasics object at 0x7f122f8a0cf8>

    @pytest.mark.polarion_id("OCS-346")
    def test_ocs_346(self):
        """
        Testing basics: secret creation,
         storage class creation  and pvc with rbd
        """
        self.rbd_secret = defaults.CSI_RBD_SECRET.copy()
>       del self.rbd_secret['data']['kubernetes']
E       KeyError: 'kubernetes'

tests/manage/test_ocs_336_346.py:107: KeyError
```

Or

```
self = <tests.manage.test_ocs_336_346.TestOSCBasics object at 0x7f122f8d5198>, test_fixture = None

    @pytest.mark.polarion_id("OCS-336")
    def test_ocs_336(self, test_fixture):
        """
        Testing basics: secret creation,
        storage class creation and pvc with cephfs
        """
        self.cephfs_secret = defaults.CSI_CEPHFS_SECRET.copy()
>       del self.cephfs_secret['data']['userID']
E       KeyError: 'userID'

tests/manage/test_ocs_336_346.py:75: KeyError
```

I haven't retried if the particular errors are caused by the issue I'm raising here, but on the other hand, with random changes in a global state which is expected to be inmutable, we can't be sure anyway.
