title: Test case for OCS-324 is broken
body:
Test case for OCS-324 is invalid, it's teardown function calls delete() on None object. 

```
request = <SubRequest 'test_fixture' for <Function test_pvc_delete_create_same_name[CephBlockPool]>>

    @pytest.fixture(params=[constants.CEPHBLOCKPOOL, constants.CEPHFILESYSTEM])
    def test_fixture(request):
        """
        Parametrized fixture which allows test to be run for different CEPH
        interface.
        The test will run for each interface provided in params.
        """
        self = request.node.cls
        self.interface_type = request.param
    
        setup(self)
        yield
>       teardown(self)

tests/manage/test_ocs_324.py:28: 


self = <class 'tests.manage.test_ocs_324.TestCaseOCS324'>

    def teardown(self):
        """
        Deletes the resources for the type of interface used.
        """
        logger.info(f"Deleting resources for {self.interface_type} interface")
    
>       PVC_OBJ.delete()
E       AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'delete'

tests/manage/test_ocs_324.py:69: AttributeError
```

We should:

 * see which value do we expect in `PVC_OBJ` in teardown
 * not pass values between test and setup/teardown functions via global variables or injecting random attributes to a test class
 * recheck if the structure of the test case makes sense

title: Change operator-openshift-with-csi.yaml due to merged changes in rook repo
body:
The content of  operator-openshift-with-csi.yaml has changed due to this [rook PR](https://github.com/rook/rook/commit/61b9f9a9f09d4d97b80982202fc3311a93c0fdb0).

**Hence, we would need to do the following:**

1. **Update existing [operator-openshift-with-csi.yaml]**(https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/templates/ocs-deployment/operator-openshift-with-csi.yaml) to sync with rook repo.

This will resolve [rook issue](https://github.com/rook/rook/issues/3312).

2. Move the check for Running status of agent pods in [test_ocs_basic_install.py](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/tests/ecosystem/deployment/test_ocs_basic_install.py )  

Due to these changes, the "csi-*" and "rook-ceph-agent-*" pods are not being deployed as part of operator-openshift-with-csi.yaml, instead come up after running cluster.yaml

Hence, we need to move the check for agent pods down after current line number 164.

```
run_cmd(
            f"oc wait --for condition=ready pod "
            f"-l app=rook-ceph-agent "
            f"-n {config.ENV_DATA['cluster_namespace']} "
            f"--timeout=120s"
        )
```

Thanks,

```
        """
        Download a file from a specified url
    
        Args:
            url (str): URL of the file to download
            filename (str): Name of the file to write the download to
    
        """

            r = requests.get(url)
            f.write(r.content)
>       assert r.ok
E       AssertionError

../utility/utils.py:673: AssertionError
  ...
16:03:04 - MainThread - utility.utils - INFO - Downloading openshift client
16:03:04 - MainThread - utility.utils - DEBUG - Directory './bin' already exists.
16:03:04 - MainThread - urllib3.connectionpool - DEBUG - Starting new HTTPS connection (1): mirror.openshift.com:443
16:03:05 - MainThread - urllib3.connectionpool - DEBUG - https://mirror.openshift.com:443 "GET /pub/openshift-v4/clients/ocp/%7B%7B%20DEPLOYMENT[%22installer_version%22]%20%7D%7D/openshift-client-linux-%7B%7B%20DEPLOYMENT[%22installer_version%22]%20%7D%7D.tar.gz HTTP/1.1" 404 440
============================================= 1 failed in 0.86 seconds ==============================================
```

The problem is, that the variables from `conf/ocsci/default_config.yaml` are
not properly processed and to `client_version` variable is assigned
`'{{ DEPLOYMENT["installer_version"] }}'` instead of the expected value.


### WORKAROUND
I didn't find the root cause yet, but there are 2 workarounds possible:

1) download openshift-client binaries manually and place it to `./bin` directory, or
2) set `client_version` in `conf/ocsci/default_config.yaml` file directly to the expected version `4.1.0`.

title: wait_for_resource() times out even after pod is successfully created.
body:
After creating a pod, wait_for_resource() is failing for me even though pods are successfully created. 

With new implementation, when helpers.create_resource(desried_state, True, **dict) is called, it internally calls ocp.wait_for_resource(desired_status,resource_name). when a pod is created through these calls, the wait_for_resource is executing the commad "oc get DeploymentConfig <deploymentconfig name> -o yaml" and checking whether desired_state == sample.get('status').get('phase') which always returns None. Because of this it times out. 

I think expecting sample.get('status').get('phase') to show desired_state is possible only if "oc get" command is executed over "pod" that got created. This is because, oc get deployment does not have the output to scan the fields status followed by phase. 

I tried creating cirros pods and the wait_for_resource failed as mentioned above.

The output of oc get deployment can be found in http://pastebin.test.redhat.com/771119

title: Storage class can not be created without specified namespace
body:
Objects created from [OCS class](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/resources/ocs.py#L14) expect object in form `object['metadata']['namespace']` as parameter. Storage class doesn't use `namespace` so it shouldn't be provided in argument.
`OCS` class will have to be changed.

title: Resource StorageClass is broken
body:
Class `StorageClass` from `resources.storage_class` have following issues:

- Directory in paths to yaml template is swapped. CephFS uses RBD dir and RBD uses CephFS dir.
- Path to yaml points to not existing file (`{rbd,cephfs}_storageclass.yaml`).
- Class gets `namespace` from template but storage classes don't use namespaces. This will be harder to fix because `OCS` class that is parent for this class expects `namespace` as argument.

title: Incorrect aguments used in PVC class constructor
body:
[PVC](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/resources/persistent_volume_claim.py) class is inheriting from [OCS](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/resources/ocs.py). In `__init__()` is:
```
        super(PVC, self).__init__(
            self.pvc_data['apiVersion'], self.pvc_data['kind'],
            self.pvc_data['metadata']['namespace']
        )
```
but  [OCS](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/resources/ocs.py) [constructor doesn't take any additional positional arguments](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/resources/ocs.py#L19):
```
class OCS(object):
    """
    Base OCSClass
    """

    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
```
If user creates instance of PVC then there is an error raised:
```
    def __init__(self, interface, **kwargs):
        """
        Initializer function
    
        Args:
            interface (str): The ceph interface to use for creating the
            PVC - 'cephfs', 'rbd', 'rgw'
    
        kwargs:
            Copy of ocs/defaults.py::PVC_DICT dictionary
        """
        self.pvc_data = default.PVC_DICT
        self.pvc_data.update(kwargs)
        super().__init__(
            self.pvc_data['apiVersion'], self.pvc_data['kind'],
>           self.pvc_data['metadata']['namespace']
        )
E       TypeError: __init__() takes 1 positional argument but 4 were given

```

Reference where I found about this workarround is mentioned here:
https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest-cov/issues/148#issuecomment-423423605

        Args:
            cmd (str): command to run
    
        Raises:
            CommandFailed: In case the command execution fails
    
        Returns:
            (str) Decoded stdout of command
    
        """
        log.info(f"Executing command: {cmd}")
        if isinstance(cmd, str):
            cmd = shlex.split(cmd)
        r = subprocess.run(
            cmd,
            stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
            stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
            stdin=subprocess.PIPE,
            **kwargs
        )
        log.debug(f"CMD output: {r.stdout.decode()}")
        if r.stderr:
            log.error(f"CMD error:: {r.stderr.decode()}")
        if r.returncode:
            raise CommandFailed(
>               f"Error during execution of command: {cmd}."
                f"\nError is {r.stderr.decode()}"
            )
E           ocs.exceptions.CommandFailed: Error during execution of command: ['oc', '-n', 'openshift-storage', '--kubeconfig', '/home/rperiyas/Documents/tools/OCS4x/auto_frame/cluster/auth/kubeconfig', 'create', '-f', 'templates/ocs-deployment/temp.yaml', '-o', 'yaml'].
E           Error is error: the namespace from the provided object "rook-ceph" does not match the namespace "openshift-storage". You must pass '--namespace=rook-ceph' to perform this operation.

../../ocs-ci/utility/utils.py:655: CommandFailed`

Version: Form May30th ocs-ci master branch

title: Fix issue with naming cluster
body: Fixing issue #102

title: When --cluster-name parameter is defined it is not applied
Utility to download and install openshift installer overrides README file of ocs-ci repository
body:
## Description of the problem

Utility function which downloads and installs openshift installer also overrides README file of ocs-ci repository.

## Reproducer

1. clone ocs-ci repo
2. prepare all configuration (such as pull secret, aws config, see docs for full details)
3. run `python -m pytest -m deployment --cluster-name example-ocs-deployment`

## Actual Results

README file in root directory of ocs-ci contains README file of openshift installer instead of one file for ocs-ci:

```
[ocsqe@localhost ocs-ci]$ git status -sb
## local
 M README.md
[ocsqe@localhost ocs-ci]$ git diff
diff --git a/README.md b/README.md
index e3aa2c3..a2ca940 100644
--- a/README.md
+++ b/README.md
@@ -1,9 +1,18 @@
-# OCS-CI
+# OpenShift Install
 
-OCS CI is a framework to test Red Hat OCS features and functionality using AWS
-and other supported platforms. The framework is based on CephCI
-  ( https://github.com/red-hat-storage/cephci )
+The OpenShift installer `openshift-install` makes it easy to get a cluster
+running on the public cloud or your local infrastructure.
 
-Documentation is structured and available under docs directory
-inside this project. You can click [HERE](docs/README.md) to see
-the Table Of Content(TOC) of our documentation.
\ No newline at end of file
+To learn more about installing OpenShift, visit [docs.openshift.com](https://docs.openshift.com)
+and select the version of OpenShift you are using.
+
+## Installing the tools
+
+After extracting this archive, you can move the `openshift-install` binary
+to a location on your PATH such as `/usr/local/bin`, or keep it in a temporary
+directory and reference it via `./openshift-install`.
+
+## License
+
+OpenShift is licensed under the Apache Public License 2.0. The source code for this
+program is [located on github](https://github.com/openshift/installer).
[ocsqe@localhost ocs-ci]$
```

Relevant logs:

```
14:09:51 - MainThread - utility.utils - INFO - Downloading openshift installer
14:10:30 - MainThread - utility.utils - INFO - Executing command: tar xzvf openshift-install.tar.gz  
```

## Expected results

README file (and any other files tracked in ocs-ci repository) are not changed during the process.

It would be more reasonable to extract only the files we expect to use.

title: get method in ocp class should handle negative scenarios
body:
There are cases where one might need to use ocp.get method to check if a resource is already available. The get method fails with CMD error if the resource is not available. If the method returns False, get method can be used to check if a resource is available before trying to create it again. 

For eg., I want to create a new project and I'd like to check if the project already exists in the cluster. 

This is how I'd like to check. 

```
 	def create_namespace(**kwargs):
  	    pdb.set_trace()
  	    project_name = (kwargs['project_name'])
  	    **if NAMESPACE.get(project_name):**
  	        log.info(f'project {project_name} exists, using the existing namespace  ')
  	        return True
```

title: typo in clusterNamespace spec in rook-ceph-block storageClass
body:
In `templates/ocs-deployment/storage-manifest.yaml`, we specify storage class as:

```
  clusternamespace: {{ cluster_namespace | default('openshift-storage') }}
```
This should read `clusterNamespace` instead. Otherwise the namespace selected is not
recognized and a default namespace is used instead by rook.

title: change the ceph failure domain to "host"
body:
Ceph failure domain should be "host" in storage-manifest.yaml.

With OSD level failure domain, failure of one node with multiple OSDs will lead to IO failure and data unavailability. 

Replica size should be 3.

body:
This patch implements the easier way how to overwrite the variables for
rendering the templates.

title: Resolve configuration discrepancies
body:
I see few minor issues with configuration, which includes:

 - [x] There are 2 directories: [conf](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/tree/7a9d56c333357e1243223346eba0f8dd60dd15a6/conf) and [config](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/tree/7a9d56c333357e1243223346eba0f8dd60dd15a6/config), it would be nice to unify them into single directory or drop one if one is not needed.
 - [x] Directory `osp` contains 2 yaml files with some configuration, without much explanation. Could this be dropped or moved somewhere?
 - [x] File [conf/ocs_basic_install.yml](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/7a9d56c333357e1243223346eba0f8dd60dd15a6/conf/ocs_basic_install.yml) seems to have no effect, as it notes that 6 worker and 6 master nodes are created in aws, but when one runs the installation, only 3 of each are created. We may either drop the file to fix the setup so that values from there are followed. Resoved by #57 and 07b5eec769d1d332c3d99d8fd1e4d86faab1fe54
 - Another config file is `.ocs-ci.yaml` created via `cp ocs-ci.yaml.template ~/.ocs-ci.yaml` as noted in [docs/getting_started.md](https://github.com/red-hat-storage/ocs-ci/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md) but I don't see problem with that.

I'm reporting this in a single issue, as the problems listed above are intertwined.
